text: Deb... Debbie keeps walking. He cruises up next to her.
Where’re you going?
(without looking back) I have $35 Linus, I can go wherever I want.
I‘1l give you a ride.
(slows/turns) He left you his car?
No. Well -- he knew I loved it...
That’s not the same thing.
(seriously/intoned) He would have wanted me to drive it. She rolls her eyes. Hot day. Long way to walk. Deb slows. So does Linus. He REVS the car in neutral.
Don’t do that, ok.
Sure. She crosses to the passenger’s side and climbs in.
When’s the funeral?
Tomorrow at noon.
Where?
Really nice place... (off her look) Queens. Linus changes lanes. Starts moving over toward the right.
Where are you going?
Why?
We thought -- it might be a good idea to see your folks.
Who thought?
You know...
Eleven of you?
Ten. Rusty’s in England. Debbie reaches out and JERKS THE WHEEL crossing two lanes traffic. They head toward New York.
That is -- dangerous!
We're going to Manhattan.
They're not gonna like that.
Anything else “they” want?
As a matter of fact... He doesn’t finish. Knows he spilled too much. Deb turns. Nods.
What?
Saul wants to tell you.
Goddammit, Linus.
He left you a note.
Danny did? DEBBIE (CONT’D) Let me see it.
Well that’s just it. In the confusion with him “passing,” and clearing out the “effects” cause we're the ones who have to deal with the “effects...”
Where’s the note?
We're not sure.
You lost it?
It‘ll turn up.
You lost my dead brother’s note to me.
I know what it said. Pause.
It said he doesn’t want you to do it.
Do what?
The job.
You know about that?
Well not exactly. But the way he was talking, it sounded pretty clear...
Jesus Christ.

He was worried about you Deb. He doesn’t want you to go back to -- you know... They have come to a stop on the George Washington Bridge all at once, Deb FLINGS OPEN THE DOOR. She steps out into bumper to bumper traffic heading toward Manhattan, leavin Linus stuck in the car.
Deb. Wait. Please!

Teeming city life. Blur and shocks of colors. Saul Leiter come to life in a modern context. INT. BERGDORF’S - DAY Debbie peruses, approaches the cosmetics counter. The salesperson is consumed with a COSTUMER. Debbie subtly gr a few bottles of face cream and continues looking, develo an air of impatience. Once the salesperson finishes --
Excuse me -- I’d like to return these.
Of course. Do you have your receipt?
(demonstrating) No but they’re unopened, haven’t been touched --
I can’t accept a return without a receipt --
They’re sealed, brand new --
I understand but we have a strict return policy and cannot accept --
This is ridiculous. I bought them a week ago.
Ma’am -- I need a receipt.
Fine. I'll keep them. Jesus. Can I at least get a bag to carry it all? As the salesperson hands her a bag with a curt smile --
Debbie approaches with a Bergdorf’s bag full of products Bubble bath, face cream, lotion -- wearing an obviously stolen pair of sunglasses.
A buzz around the reception desk. A clerk is checking out couple in their early forties. They have rolling luggage computer cases.
We're checking out of room 2814. Jeffery Crandall.
Around the corner at reception desk, Debbie lurks pretend to read a brochure.
Certainly, Mr. Crandall. We hope you had a pleasant stay.
Terrific.
My name is Monica. If there’s anything else I can do or arrange transportation...
I think we're all set.
(handing him the receipt) Thank you for staying with us. Debbie glances up as...
Wheels their luggage toward the door.
The Crandall’s climb into an Uber headed toward JFK.
Debbie lounges back in a large overstuffed chair.

(into the phone) Hi, this is Mrs. Crandall, we just checked out of 2814. Can I speak to Monica, please? (beat) Oh, hi Monica -- thanks so much. Something has come up and we’re going to need the room another night. (a beat) Oh, bless you. We’re just going to grab quick bite. Could you get the maid in there now? (beat) Thanks.
The elevator door opens. Debbie steps out, spots the maid cart. Bingo. She heads off toward 2814.  INT. HOTEL ROOM - PLAZA —- CONTINUOUS The MAID fixes pillows. She looks up as Debbie enters.
Hi. Sorry. Can you just finish this later? I’ve just got to get off my feet.
Of course. Sorry. She gathers the rest of her things and hurries toward the door.
Wait. She crosses to the maids cart and grabs a handful of chocolates.
Debbie luxuriates in a bath with all of New York out a hu picture window beside her. The lights glisten. The planes glide by. She sinks a little lower in the warm water. Closes her eyes...
CATE late 30’s, dressed in all black at a landing, hoveri above her club. It’s packed with kids and sweat. She glances over at the bar.
Is pouring Grey Goose into a tumbler. She catches Cate’s who shakes her head. The woman, chastised, replaces the G Goose and grabs a bottle of well vodka...
She scans the floor: hormones and sweat. In the far corne Lebron James is towering above the throng, dancing. Cate descends the stairs and crosses to one of her “Bottle Gir
Did you get him yet?

No. I will. Cate looks at her with judgement: "C’mon.” The girl grabs her cell phone hurries across the floor. CATE wanders toward the back of the club and spots a gir smoking in the doorway to the alley. She crosses to her a the girl immediately drops her cigarette, grinding it out the ground.
On a break?
Yeah.
How’s the line?
It’s pretty good.
Is it down the block?
(busted) Not quite.
You know I need a long line right?
Sorry. I just got cold.
Here. Take this. She removes her scarf, wraps it around the girl’s neck th smiles. It’s a “get-the fuck-out-there smile,” but still smile.

Thanks. ACROSS THE CLUB... Lebron is seriously into the music when the Bottle Girl c up and tries to take a selfie. (The height differential i problematic.) He squats lower and extends the camera... CATE... Watching it.
(to her bouncer) Make sure she pushes that out now.
Hashtag?

How bout our address. AND SHE IS MOVING AGAIN, this time toward the VIP area wh a YOUNG MAN is holding court with three women and a bottl Dom. Heavily tatted and well toned. Cate glares -- he loo up...
(beat) They said I could.
Who?
The guy at the door.
Instead of buying-off my doorman why don’t you pay your bill from last time?
(scared) Ok.
Ok. She turns to leave and gets a text. Cate glances down whi she walks.
“Where is the fkng cemetery? 12 O'clock?” SHE smiles walking away...
Debbie wakes up to see Manhattan doing the same out her window. Dawn breaks over the skyline as she rises, stretches, and takes in the view -- her first good night' sleep in four years.
BERGDORF’S She enters the same revolving doors as she did yesterday, disappearing for a beat...
Now dressed in a tasteful black suit with sensible shoes.
Gravestones compressed in a long lens and stretching to t horizon. A massive 747 lands in the background.
Black SUV’s roll through the gates.
Everyone is there. BASHER, Linus, SAUL, The MALLOY BROTHE even YEN.
With gold handles. A lovely touch of Vegas.
REUBEN (Elliott Gould) is eulogizing:
Danny Ocean lived a rich full life. By any measure, he was a success. There is more rustling and a few eye rolls. Reuben continues.
Whether in business, not all of which we can discuss today... A few sighs of relief.
Or as a loving son, to Dennis and Darlene. Everyone turns to acknowledge DENNIS OCEAN, seated on the left.
Stares straight ahead. Doesn’t glance at her father.
Or as a brother. She looks up. Shakes her head: don’t you dare.  11.
(stumbles) Who -- had a sister. As -- brothers do...
People are milling around outside the chapel. Debbie approaches Saul (Carl Reiner.)
Hello, Saul.
Sweetie. Oh my gosh. (kisses) You look great.
No I don’t.
Well -- you made it.
Yeah.
Listen to me for a minute...
Don't.
It killed him, Debbie. This life -- it killed him.
He had a genetic valve disorder.
Well it didn’t help. And it’s no good for you either. Please don’t do this.
Do what?
Whatever it is he wouldn’t tell us you were gonna do. Debbie smiles -- doesn’t respond. She leans over and kiss Saul on the cheek.  12.
Hot day. Birds. She takes off her jacket. Funny how a graveyard can feel like the country. Basher (Don Cheadle) comes up beside her.
‘ello love.
You too?
No... Not me. She smiles at him.
Hear it’s good though.
He told you?
Just said it was “somethin’.” An’ that it was pretty amazing.
He said that?
Mmm. He said it was insane and you'd end up back in jail but it was pretty brilliant. Sinks in.
You coming back to the house?
Nah. She motions toward the gang. He nods.
Sure. (beat) One question.
What’s that?
(leans in/a wink) Why’d you tell him, love?  13.
The one question she can’t answer. It lingers with her. H gives her a kiss on the cheek and heads on his way.
Two short beeps. Deb turns...
The smoked window of a black SUV lowers revealing --
Blonde, stylish, hair perfectly messy. Her car radio fill the graveyard.
Deb climbs in the passengers side as Cate turns down the music. Cate grabs her friend’s face. Big kiss on the chee
Easy. I’ve been in the slammer.
Really? Hadn’t heard.
Thanks. That was stressful...
I’m sure.
Everybody trying to get me to go straight.
Kind of cheeky. They’re crooks too.

No kidding. Cate swings the car onto the expressway. Deb takes off he shoes. Puts her bare feet on the dashboard and rubs them. Deb puts her bare feet on the dashboard. DEBBIE (CONT’D) You get the credit line?
Not yet.
Why?
Don’t know what it’s for. (off her look) Please don’t do that?
Do what? Cate imitates her expression. DEBBIE (CONT’D) Oh. That’s my “just spent four- years in jail and my partner lets me down face.”

I’m not your partner yet. (cell phone rings) Hello? (beat) I don’t care Jeffrey... No I don’t want to talk to her... (another beat) ‘Cause it’s not her job anymore. It was her job until she got fired, now it’s not her job... (listens) She can write me five letters, she’s not getting her job back. (beat) Because she stole from me Jeffrey and people who steal are not trustworthy. On that, she happens to lock eyes Deb who starts to laugh Cate can’t help it smiles too. Hangs up.
I mean “normal” people who steal. Not...
Like professionals?
Yeah. Them.
The lights switch on, illuminating a huge empty space. gorgeous in its decay. Carved wood and peeling plaster. gold leaf is sporadic.  She flips Deb looks 15.
This is great.
Try heating it. on some more lights.
There’s a room for you upstairs.
New club?
Maybe one day. around. More space than she’s seen in five years.
Did you call Kendall?
She quit. Moved to Hawaii.
(surveying the room) What about Paige?
(stops) It would honestly help if I knew what all of this was for.
I know... I know... I’1l1 tell you tomorrow. Deb deposits her bag, crosses to Cate. Gives her a kiss o the cheek. She turns DEBBIE (CONT’D) I’ll see ya later.
You just got here.
I've been inside for five years. I’m going for a walk. and heads up the aisle of the theater...
Debbie walks down a familiar cobblestone street. Though s seems composed, a rage grows within her as she approaches  16.

Debbie walks into mecca for the downtown art scene. KLAUS GUNTHER makes Gagosian jealous. Sycophants, hipsters and lot of money. And in the center of it all stands Klaus himself: undeniably handsome, just as oily, he wears a wh linen shirt unbuttoned to the jewlery. You should see through this guy but you can’t. Debbie grabs a glass of champagne from a waiter and crosses toward him.
Is talking with a group of young women, when he spots Deb and shifts from charm to restrained terror. He makes quic apologies and starts to leave...
Blocks his path.
(frozen) What are you doing here?
Patron of the arts.
I have a restraining order.
Good. She steps really close to him -- an intimate moment -- DEBBIE (CONT’D) Do you know what a shiv is? He feels something sharp against his ribs. Gasps --
Stop it --

I made this one. Proud of it, too. See -- it’s important not to melt the toothbrush too much. That way it keeps its length and the strength. So when you stab, you slice up and around. Debbie drags the shiv up the front of his shirt, towards neck. To a bystander it might look like a flirtatious mov with a large toothpick.  17. DEBBIE (CONT’D) Nice face. Inside you’re what we like to call “a pretty girl” --
I'll call the police -- Deb takes the shiv and slices up the front of his shirt, shredding it. She pops the button on his collar, taking i for a souvenir.
Auf Wiedersehen. Debbie strides out, still purposeful, while Klaus looks o terrified.
All fluorescence and backlit pictures of the dishes. Debb stands at the counter -- draws a long breath of General Tso’s. They hand her a white plastic bag.
It’s dark. A few safety lights are on. Deb enters the bac of the theater and crosses to a staircase on the side of stage carrying her take out.
It used to be a rehearsal studio. Vast and open with vari bits of living area defined by loose furniture. It’s chic a very hard-to-define-kind-of-way.
Crosses to the kitchen area, fishes through drawers for a plate and decamps at the small kitchen table.
She takes out the still-warm white containers and dumps t on her plate. Can’t get to the chopsticks fast enough...
Is that all for you?
(turning/mouthful ) Oh, hi. Want some.
No.  18. Cate’s wearing a silk chinese robe. She crosses to the table. Sits.
It’s late.
Took a walk.
Where? Deb doesn’t answer. They look at each other for a beat an exchange five or six lines of unspoken conversation.
Why would you do something like that?
I had to.
No, you didn’t.
Closure?
Bullshit. Did he see you?
Oh yeah. Debbie takes the shiv out of her purse and shows it to Ca Toothbrush on one end, lethal blade on the other.
Jesus. (beat) Did you “use it?”
Just a button. She puts Klaus’ button on the table. Cate laughs. They share the moment. Then suddenly...
(calls out) Hey, Luis... You gotta go. Cate doesn’t turn as the young man from the club enters w pants but no shirt. Even more muscles. Even more ink.
I can wait.  19.
That’s ok. I’11 see you soon.
Seriously.
(turns) Seriously. Go. Luis gets the hints and grabs his shirt, heading downstai
Does he have to go? Cate laughs. Deb slides over the carton of orange chicken
The place is waking up from the night before. MEN in ORAN SUITS hang off the back of trucks collecting trash.

She's wide awake. Cate’s “guest room” is a partitioned sp filled with boxes of bootlegged vodka. A certain larcenou charm with a stunning view of the Manhattan Bridge. Deb s up in bed. Stretches (freedom). She stares out the window at the building across the alley -- seems to pause...

ZIRGA (CARL REINER) AND TERRY BENEDICT (ANDY GARCIA) walk casino floor with their respective henchmen behind them. They pass. DANNY... .--who glances up from his chair at the video poker machi THE SHOT CONTINUES TO SUDDENLY INCLUDE... DEBBIE... .--who stands at the progressive slots holding a bucket o Silver dollars (STILL OCEAN’S ELEVEN -- WE JUST HAVEN’T S THIS BEFORE. Deb clocks Benedict as he passes, feeds a dollar token in the slot, and pulls the huge lever. Wheels spin...
(jackpot) OH MY GOD...  20.
Benedict strides down the hallway with two employees in tow...
That’s not supposed to hit ‘til December.
I understand sir.
Did you check the machine?
Bright neon. No frills. Deb sits on a hard plastic chair. Turns... Looks at Benedict...

(as he enters) Where’s my money! Benedict pauses at the door. Takes her in. DEBBIE (CONT’D) I drove here from Bakersfield. SERIES OF SHOTS. OCEAN’S ELEVEN The swat team carries out the money. The van arrives at the airport. The team meets at the Bellagio fountain.
Bullshit, Danny!
She yells into a pay phone.

“Pulled a lever”? You think that’s what I did? I “pulled a lever?” (beat) Yeah, and if I hadn’t you would have had Terry Benedict up your ass. I bought you time Danny. I deserve the same share as everybody else... (beat) No! Don’t you dare hang... (beat/quieter) ...up. Asshole.  21.
It’s a massive landscape. People stroll. Boats sail. Kite fly. It would take a moment to pick out the two women heading toward the camera.
Honestly when I tell you, it’s going to sound a little...
Crazy?
Maybe. But there aren’t any holes. I’ve gone through it a million times.
They stroll toward the camera in the dappled sunlight. As they leave the narrow path, Central Park opens in front o them. Fifth Avenue looms. Deb stops -- turns toward Cate.
What? Deb motions in front of her.
Trees? Deb points to...
Rising up above the treeline.
She cocks her head slightly, takes in the museum. Then sh reaches for Deb’s hand and walks her slowly over to a par bench. They sit together.

(deep breath/softly) Look -- I have a friend with a house on Fire Island. He’s in Europe for a few months and the place is just sitting empty. You could go out there and stare at the water and just...
This works, Cate.  22.
I’m sure.
It really works.
(pause) That’s a museum, Debbie. And they care about the things inside it. That’s what makes it a museum.
We're not robbing the museum. Pause... DEBBIE (CONT’D) We're robbing someone in the museum. The museum is just the decoy. She looks back at it...
They mingle with tourists ambling by the Whistlers and Winslow Homers. John Singer Sargent’s ‘Madam X’ looks dow as they walk by...
They stand in front of a sign next to the ticket booths. sign reads: “CLOSED THE FIRST MONDAY IN MAY.”
First Monday in May?
Shh.
Years of haute couture on display. The richest models in world wear the most expensive and glamorous fashion. They glide in slow motion past a million strobes as Debbie explains:
It’s the biggest event of the year. Hundreds of the richest people gathered under one roof...  23.
So...
They eat a falafel. Deb gestures. Cate nods.

head_text.subj: SERIES OF SHOTS. MOS, (LONG LENS - FAR AWAY)

text: Through the bustle and traffic of New York, Deb explains job’. In subways... Taxi’s... Restaurants... With diagrams, gestures, and models made of salt shakers and s cubes. Slowly, through it all, Cate’s body language subtl changes. She begins, literally, to lean in until...
They sit at a table caffeinating in the large open atrium
Wow.
Wow as in yes?
As in: I get it. It’s kind of brilliant.
I had some time on my hands.
It’s dangerous...
No doubt. But that’s not why I like it. This works.
(weighs it) You know I don’t owe you anything.
Just help me figure it out. Then see how you feel. If you don’t like it, you don’t have to do it. You have an off ramp. There is an irritating, irresistible quality that makes h Debbie Ocean.
So what’s first?  24.
We need a designer.
INT. CATE’S LOFT They sit in front of the big screen with the documentary playing. They review a large portfolio book of various designers, their work enshrined in plastic.
So I thought about Galliano, but I don’t think Anna’s gonna let him dress anybody.
Right.
There’s Largerfeld but it’s kind of Dr. Strangelove. Not sure it’s the right fit. But here, look at this... She spins the book. Hovers over it...
Rose Weil? (beat) I know that name.
Huge in the 90’s. New Romantic stuff. Edwardian collars. But... (flips a page) Hasn’t gone so well lately. She owes the IRS 5 million dollars.
Woah.
It’s bad. A lien on her assets. Impounded her passport. The bank seized her townhouse.
She sounds perfect.
The name “ROSE WEIL” emblazoned on a wall.  25. After a minute ROSE WEIL, 40’s, flustered, lurches toward trash can, vomiting pre-show.
The show was meant to save her.
Amazonian women appear in outfits that suggest a labored attempt at a Victorian theme -- high buttons, lace bodice

If the new line doesn’t take off, she could even be prosecuted. There is a distracting murmur -- this is not going well. Amongst the unimpressed celebrities, a worried group of middle-aged, Mid-Western Men sit in the front row.
Got a credit line from an Omaha Bank. The only ones who would still loan her money... They literally are soaked in sweat -- stare perplexed at runway at...
Tough way to get into fashion.

Strides out in a corset with over abundance metal buckles BDSM meets Pirates of the Caribbean. She turns to the top of the runway to introduce Rose, but one appears. Finally, one of the models drags her on-stag to take a bow before a half-empty tent. INT. BACKSTAGE —- FASHION SHOW - LATER The silent break-down of a failed show: Naked models down champagne, designer detritus covers the floor -- no one scurries to pick it up. Cate wanders through the room, searching for Rose. She pauses at the sound of SOBS coming from the other side of closet door. Cate opens it to find a weeping Rose, sittin on the floor, eating Nutella.
(beat) It was gorgeous.
(looks up/tear stained) It was shite.  26.
I think that’s a little harsh.
“Derivative of myself.” That's what they say. Do you know what a hell that is? Resenting who you were because you’ll never be that again -- (shovels Nutella) How did I get here?
(sinks to the floor/gently) You spent 18 million dollars in two years. You had two house boats on the Seine. Cate takes her hand.
(softly) I know. And they were divine. (a beat) I’m old.
You're not old --
I’m old and -- (heaves) I’m going to go to prison -- and (heaves) And then I’m going to be poor..
Not necessarily. Rose looks up. Hmm?
What if I could make all of this go away. Even get your passport back. Long pause --
What do I have to do?
Dress Daphne Kluger for the Met Ball. Rose stares up her.  27.
Are you real?
Very.
(means it) You’re an angel. Cate shrugs. She’ll take it.

PAPARAZZI FLASH -- As the glare recedes, a stunning face revealed like a developing photograph -- DAPHNE KLUGER, 3 goofy and aloof and devastatingly charming. She’s been famous for a while and she likes it. Daphne soaks up the flash as the Chairwoman of the Costume Institute introduc her --

The Met Ball is all about grace and elegance and refinement -- so everyone can understand why we chose Ms. Kluger to host it. The crowd erupts in laughter, heads thrown back and shoul rising like a ballet of bobble-heads. Except for Cate and Debbie, seated in the back row, straight-faced. A REPORTE raises his hand --
Do you know who you’re wearing?
Right now? (she looks under her shirt) Under Armour?
No, who is dressing you?
I normally do it myself unless I’m really wasted.
The designer --
Don’t you guys have something better to worry about -- like climate change? (they’re not budging) (MORE )
I promise the moment we decide on a designer you'll be the first to know.
Debbie and Cate exchange a look. INT. CATE’S LOFT - DEBBIE, CATE, AND ROSE WEIL They leaf through pictures of Daphne Kluger.
Oh. She’s sort of divine. Lovely bust.
Sure.
Maybe something simple. Just velvet with no other...
Maybe this. 28. She tosses an embossed photo on the table. Rose leans in.
Over a fifty diamonds. Even the photo glistens.
Oh my.
It’s called the Harrington necklace. Originally commissioned for an American oil magnate. Weighs over six pounds.
Texans.
When he died they sold it back to Tiffany’s who’ve kept it in their vault ever since.
They never let it out.
Oh. Then how do we...
They might let it out for her.  29.
This years theme is Starry Night. A million jewels glittering in the night sky.
And if you were to insist... On behalf of Daphne Kluger...
Ooooh... Through all of her haze, Rose begins to get it...
It’s a lovely piece.
No shit.

head_text.subj: MACRO IMAGE OF A FLAWLESS DIAMOND

text: It kicks prisms of light all over the frame -- perfect li rainbows. OVER THIS -- IN HINDI:
(This isn’t flawless.)

AMITA (Mindy Kaling) holds a large diamond up to her loup Her mother, elegant, glamorous, dripping in jewels, hover close by as she examines it. Behind them are half a dozen other jewlers at a long work bench -- all Indian as well all family. There are glass jars of candy -- everywhere. AMITA’S MOTHER (It’s a good stone. What’s the matter with you?)
(I work here -- stop selling me.)
Debbie stands at the railing staring out over the water a they head past Ellis Island.
She’s like family. My dad used to fence stuff through the store. The island approaches...  30.
In Hindi:
(This diamond is a K -- at best.) AMITA’S MOTHER (It's an H -- )
(You’re out of your mind.) AMITA’S MOTHER (I’m concerned about your vision)
(This is piss yellow --) AMITA’S MOTHER (Why are you so vulgar. If your father was alive...)

(Grade it yourself!) AMITA’S MOTHER (This is why you have no husband.) Amita looks up, with the loupe on. AMITA’S POV -- THROUGH THE LOUPE Debbie (highly magnified) stands out the window -- waving signaling for Amita to join her.
Amita approaches Debbie --
What’re you doing here?
Sorry to hear about your pops.
Yeah, thanks... (re: her mother/sotto) Sometimes I wish she’d join him. (beat) Sorry about Danny.  31.
Yeah well... I got something for you. A job.
I heard that didn’t work out too well.
Happens.
What? You want to run some stuff through the store?
Little more than that. (beat) How long would it take you to make 8 pieces of jewelry? If the stones are already cut.
I don’t know. Six hours?
What if I told you didn’t have to live with your mother anymore? Amita raises an eyebrow...
Deb stands at the rail on her cell phone.

(into the phone) Yeah. She’s all good. But we may have to put her up for a while. Had a fight with her mom. INT. CATE’S LOFT A 23 year old GIRL (huge dreads and lots of tats) sits cr legged in a knoll womb chair with an industrial looking computer on her lap. Cate sits across from her staring as she pounds away at her keyboard.
(suddenly) Wow.
What?  32. The girl doesn't answer but stays focused on her screen. Cate leans forward, paying rapt attention.
I am never taking the F train again. Debbie comes bounding through the doorway with loads of energy. DEBBIE (CONT’D) (sees the girl) Hi there.
Shh.
What?
She's “in.”
In where?
Is this what you mean? There’s just a lot of vases. Cate leans over and looks at her screen.
Yeah. That’s the Egyptian wing.
Shes’s in The Met? Debbie crosses over and looks.
(glancing at Deb) Security cameras.
Wow.
Here’s some more. Just a lot of pictures...
Kandinsky.
Hi. I’m Debbie.  33. She looks up. Squints through the dreads.
Nine Ball.
What’s your real name?
(shrugs) Eight Ball.
We use real names around here.
Can we talk for a minute.
They tuck into the kitchen.
She’s one of the best hackers in the world.
I’m honored.
She has other clients. They don’t know her real name either.
She has other clients? Now?
Yeah.
Did you tell her what her cut was?
‘Course. High priced talent. They head around the corner.
Nine Ball continues to clack away, rocking back and forth a self-soothing kind of way.
Um, Nine ball? Should I call you Nine?  34.
Or Baller. (beat) You know, your footprint sucks, right?
What?
Your footprint. If you want to steal shit you gotta clean this up. My little sister could hack you.
Oh. Cause we hired a guy who... Nine Ball taps a couple of keystrokes and the lights shut off. She taps them again and they turn back on.
Gotcha.
We'll fix that.
Awesome. I gotta jet. She grabs her laptop and leaves the frame. Cate and deb exchange a look.
How old is she?
You don’t want to know.
Bells. Whistles...
Benedict strides down the hallway with two employees in tow...
Bright neon. No frills. Deb sits on a hard plastic chair. Turns... Looks at Benedict...  35.
(as he enters) Where’s my money!
She yells into a pay phone.

“Pulled a lever”? You think that’s what I did? I “pulled a lever?” A BLACK JACK TABLE - LATER THAT DAY... Debbie fumes in the “first base” position all the way to right of the dealer. She has a drink and stack of chips i front of her. THE DEALER... Whisks cards across the table and pulls a 9. Debbie stand with an 18. So does everyone else at the table. The deale flips her hole card and shows an 8 to total 17. SLOW MOTION DEBBIE’S HAND In one smooth move she reaches for her drink, and swaps_h stack of 5 red chips for 4 red and one black hundred doll chip underneath. If you blinked you’d miss it.
The dealer spreads out her chips and pays her $115, match her three reds and one black. A good hustle.
Looks across the table to see...
Staring at her. She glances away at the eye contact. They don’t know each other yet.
Debbie gets a 14 and busts. No need to switch chips this time. The dealer busts as well. Debbie looks back across the table at --
Who_does the exact same thing that Debbie did. Reaches fo the drink, switches out a stack of four reds for three re and_a black.
Nice to meet you.

EXT. CAESAR’S PALACE POOL - (VERY HOT) DAY Modeled after the Baths of Caracalla. White columns and short togas. Deb lies on a chaise lounge eyes closed, han clenched around her drink. A shadow crosses over her.
Hello.
Debbie looks up to see her blocking out the sun. Cate has huge hat. Almost religious. She sits on the chaise next t her.
I think we have something in common.
I got there first.
I know. Cate hands her a wad of cash.
I don’t want a cut.
Do you know what a Savannah is?
Yeah. Past-posting at a roulette wheel. Double act. A mechanic and a payout.
That’s right.
(gets it) I’m Debbie. Extends her hand. Cate takes it.
Cate Richmond. I knew your brother.  37.
Who didn’t?
Not like that. We did some work together.
So did we. Had a little trouble settling.
So did I.
(takes her in) So we were at that table together by accident?
(maybe ) Of course. Beat. They both laugh. Sure. Whatever.
What are you thinking?
Emerging side by side from the subway in QUEENS. There is purpose in their step.
This girl has the best hands I’ve ever seen. Literally. It’s such a waste.
Deft hands shuffle and deal Three Card Monte in a blur. A woman’s hand adorned with nail art and a dozen bracelets the honors. Over this -- a voice of undetermined origin:

(fast, like an auctioneer) Ok following the queen, following the queen aaaaaaaaaaaand you know what i see? -i see a little silhouett-o of a man bout to lose, bout to lose but will he do the fandango? Probably not cuz THAT’S A 2 OF SPADES THANK U, COME AGAIN.  38.

She works her magic to a visiting chump and his friend fr Manhattan. Kids gather round to watch the abuse on rebuil BMX bikes. Constance has a yellow hoodie and wears huge shades -- a hybrid between an insect and an aviator.

head_text.subj: DEBBIE AND CATE. FROM ACROSS THE STREET

text: They watch the show from a distance.
Really?
Everyone you sent me was too hot. The turnover on pickpockets is huge.
She fans a deck. Deals out three new cards.

How about you sir? What’s your name? Is it Wifi? ‘Cause I feel a connection. Now how about you put that Fossil brand wallet where that weird, misshapen mouth is. Don’t know how to play? Well here’s what we do -- we keep your eyes on the queen. Eyes on the queen, eyes on the queen. (Just like last night) Keep your eyes are on the queen and- - look I'm taking it slow, taking it slooow, taking and our eyes are on the queen, eyes on the queen. But. Oh. Wait. Oh no. But where she at, though? Where that bitch at? Is she gonna be over here on the left,? Is she on the right? Or is she in the center? Is that bitch a liberal-leaning libertarian? He points and she flips the card. CONSTANCE (CONT’D) I don’t know but I do know that THAT’S A 3 OF HEARTS -- so what’s it gonna be? I take cash only honey no no cash only honey, no cash no -- honey don’t mope. Just gimme the dope. Constance snatches his money and quickly slips off his Ro in the process.  39.
We take most major credits -- an we keep em. (sees Debbie and Cate) Oh, look -- two real housewives. As he turns to look at Deb and Cate, Constance reaches ar and lifts his wallet.
Sweetie that’s it for tonight. I gotta headache. We’1l do it tomorrow. I promise. Kissing noises and she’s gone.
We’re amateurs.
Debbie and Cate sit across from Constance, housing a sub.
(incredulous) So -- I'm just slipping one necklace?
You are. Yes.
Really? That’s it?
It’s a very nice necklace.
An’ this is legit? I mean you’re serious -- about my cut and all?
A hundred percent.
Ok. I’m in and... (reaches into her pocket) ..-in that case, here. She hands Cate back her watch.  40. CONSTANCE (CONT’D) I just love the smell of that Subway bread.

With luminous images of precious jewels. A woman’s finger swipes it and more massive rocks appear. Swipes again -- emerald... INT. CATE’S CLUB - NIGHT She stands at the bar in thick black reading glasses, pee down at the iPAD. A cacophony is pounding all around her Cate is extreme focus: stare -- swipe. Stare -- swipe...
No?
Hmm?
The guy. Jeff. He has three guys with him.
Ok.
But he’s the only one on the list.
Just let ‘em in. And she goes back to her jewlery. Cate swipes as...
Makes solid contact with a soccer ball.
The shot nails the door, mid pane, leaving a huge mark.
A well maintained woman in her mid forties wears athletic garb and is parked with the Sunday Times on her (new) por furniture.
Derek, please, that is not a goal. That is a plate glass win...  41. And she stops mid sentence.
Debbie’s head hovers above the fence line. She locks eyes with her.
Hi, Tam.
Freezes in a paralyzed suburban smile...
Mommy, Derek said I couldn’t play anymore because he wants to only have another kind of game that...
Sweetie -- Mommy has to talk to an old friend now. Tammy gets up slowly and walks the other direction toward garage. She glances back and motions for Debbie to meet h on the other side of the house.
INT. FOUR CAR GARAGE - TAMMY’S HOUSE - CONTINUOUS Like the Container Store and Fed Ex had a love child. A suburban warehouse. Tammy’s “eBay Top Seller” Award hangs prominently on the wall.

Are you really screening my calls? Deb moves closer. Tammy inhales sharply. DEBBIE (CONT’D) (re: the garage set-up) This is impressive. Debbie peers behind a slightly ajar door which leads to b light lit storage room full of even hotter items --
What are you doing here? I thought you were --
I got out. Look at all this. I thought you retired.
I did.  42.
(motioning) I guess you’re just collecting knock-off luggage. (smiles) Not as much as fun as hijacking a truck or smuggling shit ina tugboat...
What do you want? Debbie steps closer, an intimate tension growing --
(breathy) Just wanted to reconnect. Tammy swallows. DEBBIE (CONT’D) You're not bored out here, are you Tam?
(tense/physical proximity) I’m happy... Out here. Debbie places a strand of Tammy’s hair behind her ear.
(she gets closer) What about in here? (touches her “heart”) How do you feel inside. (closer) When you lie awake at night. Does he snore?
No. (Deb breathes in her ear) A little.
I need a fence.
I -- stopped doing that.
(closer still) You can start again. You can do anything you want. (hot breath) You were the best, Tam. The best I've ever... (MORE )
(closer) ..-worked with. Debbie is close enough to kiss Tammy. DEREK, Tammy’s 4 ye old, opens the door --
Mommy --
(strained, snaps her head) Yes, sweetie?
I just wanted to say I love you.
I love you, too -- The door closes.
No one else can do what you do.
Eyes locked...
EXT. TAMMY’S HOUSE - LATER ANGLE ON -- Tammy, from inside the trunk of her car. She throws a suitcase in.
It’s just a work trip, honey. Mommy will be back soon. The trunk closes.
INT. CATE’S THEATER — An old master switch is thrown, bathing the stage in ligh
Various members of the team wander in to the aging theate taking in the faded glory. They meet and mingle. Orange juice and bagels sit on the edge of the stage.
Down here, everybody.

“THE MEETING” Everyone is gathered on stage with folding chairs and loo furniture. Downstage, near the broken footlights, sits a large object covered with a sheet. A projector illuminate the back wall.
Thank you all for coming. We'd like to present you with a hypothetical situation. 16.5 million dollars in each of your bank accounts. A little over two weeks from now.
How hypothetical?
Not very. Unless we screw up. The women make eyes. Nobody moves. Debbie removes the sat sheet covering a perfect 3D replica of the Met.
In three and a half weeks the Met will be hosting its annual ball to celebrate the new Costume Exhibit.
And we're going to rob it.
(nausea) Christ. Within the 3D model is a red carpet, the exhibit and the Temple of Dendur --

-- Not the ball itself, but a very important set of diamonds that will be “attending” the ball -- The video of the “Harrington” diamond necklace plays on screen. Amita lets out a half-orgasmic sigh --
On the neck of Daphne Kluger. Split Screen -- a picture of Ms. Kluger appears next to t video of the necklace.  45.
Who Rose will be dressing.
But I don’t know Daphne K --
You will.
With her on board, we can get the necklace out of the vault --
(indicates Nine Ball) -- Infiltrate both Met Security -- A shot of the hundreds of Met Security Domes that Cate an Debbie have been snapping fill the screen --
(nod to Tammy) And the Gala itself --
Considered to be the most exclusive party invitation in the world --
When Daphne becomes suddenly ill and goes to the bathroom --
How do we do that?
Ipecac.
Ew.
Constance will do what Constance does -- Constance doffs an imaginary hat.
The necklace will be delivered to Amita, at a secure location inside the museum --
Where she will fashion it into eight distinctive pieces of jewelry.  46.

Making all the gorgeous women in this room even more beautiful as they wear them out into the night -- dispersing in eight different directions, and pulling off one of the biggest jewel heists in history. The team stares at them, dumbfounded.
Shut up.
— EVENING
Where are we going?
Le Cirque.
Are we going to meet Daphne Kluger?
No.
We're going to meet someone who makes Daphne Kluger jealous.
Debbie and Cate sit across from Rose -- sweating profusel and tearing at bread.
In a minute we are going to get up and someone you know will sit down.
I know her?
Not personally. Just be cool, aloof --
Kind, but not too kind.
You're sweating.  47.
I sweat.
Don't.
She has a new engagement ring, take her hand, make physical contact, that’s when we’ll get it.
It? Cate and Debbie rise. Rose continues to sweat. Fans herself. After a beat, the actress PENELOPE STERN sits do
Hi, wow --
(faint/British) Hi.
(takes Rose’s hand) Hi. (a beat) I just have to say -- I think you are so brilliant. Like -- beyond. Honestly, I have always dreamed about getting married in one of your dresses. Is that so crazy?
No... (glances toward the window/sees Deb and Cate) ...Not as crazy as that rock...
My ring?
May I? Rose takes Penelope’s hand, making sure to maintain the moment of intimacy long enough, as she peers overs Penelo shoulder to --
DEBBIE’S POV -- through a telephoto camera lens -- Debbie Cate take photos through the window. CLICK.
Lands on a table with a picture of Rose and Penelope dini over candlelight. The headline is evocative: “Be My Dress Be My Dress, Be My Dress -- Met Gala Courtship.”
Daphne Kluger looks at an underling...
Rose Weil? Is she still alive? (fuming nonetheless) So what are we doing about this?
Rose and Daphne sit on the long velvet bench in the corne
Remember -- indifference is the greatest aphrodisiac.
Thanks for coming on such short notice.
Of course. Cate appears on the balcony. She crosses, Rose’s eyes tra her, looking over Daphne’s shoulder --
I've always admired you. I have so many of your pieces --
Really?

(no) Oh, yeah. Debbie appears at the other end of the balcony. Rose’s ey shift -- DAPHNE KLUGER (CONT’D) Obviously this search hasn’t been easy, and so far everything’s been a little, well, boring -- Rose still looks past Daphne -- Debbie and Cate are now staring at her, pressed up against the glass.

Debbie plasters her face against the clear window. Rose stares at them looking past Daphne and it’s starting to p her off. DAPHNE KLUGER (CONT’D) -- well you seem different, a little twisted -- like me. Daphne realizes she has completely lost Rose -- DAPHNE KLUGER (CONT’D) What is going on -- Daphne looks over her shoulder out the window -- Cate and Debbie have disappeared. Rose finally looks at Daphne.
I’m sorry -- what were you saying?

I’m trying to hire you. What, did you forget your Adderall? Jesus -- Daphne downs her whiskey, restores the glass. DAPHNE KLUGER (CONT’D) For the Met ball. I want you to dress me. Rose looks off to the balcony, beaming with satisfaction. CATE AND DEBBIE... Sit on the edge of planter, exhausted --
Illuminated in blue light as she stares into a monitor.
This is dope.
The others hover around her. Next to them is a 3D printer the size of a large desk. It has tubes and pumps and tank Very industrial.
Where'd you get it?
(a true “fence”) Items “arrive” Deb. No one “gets” them from “anywhere.”  50.
O-kay...
Ready. She hits a keystroke and the printer begins to WHINE. A lucite replica of the Statue of Liberty begins to emerge front of them.
Once we get the scan of the necklace, we can print a replica in zirconium.
(watching it grow) Wo! Print me a dude.
Get me a scan.
(to Amita) No problem. Let’s go get her a “scan.” Giggles. She nudges Amita who looks embarrassed but intrigued. They wander off together.
(turning to Deb) Three weeks to go.

Three different STUNNING necklaces sit atop black velvet stands. WIDER. INT. TIFFANY’S - PRIVATE SHOWROOM A very proud, tightly-wound TIFFANY’S EXEC fawns over Ros and Amita, posing as her assitant. Amita has a business s and an iPAD. Rose wears a fashionable pair of Google Glasses.
Where is it?
We thought you might want to see these first --
These aren't the Harrington.  51.
I know. It’s just that -- there are certain logistical problems with that particular necklace.
We wouldn’t even know how to insure it.
Well -- we were very clear on the phone. We’re only interested in the Harrington. TIFFANY’S EXEC That would just have to be a much longer discussion.
(a new confidence) I understand. Ok. Much thanks. We'll be going now. Rose turns toward the door Amita following instilling pan in the eyes of the two executives. TIFFANY’S EXEC Wait.
Stops. Turns...
The elevator doors open -- the Associate and TWO GUARDS w out into a hallway -- across from them is a classic VAULT door. Rose and Amita wait while they spin the two large wheels.
We need a little under five minutes with the necklace to get the scan. The vault door swings open.
A LOCK-BOX sitting atop crushed black velvet.

Wearing Google glasses, adjusts them slightly. She waits anxiously.  52. ROSE’S POV - NECKLACE - THROUGH THE GOOGLE GLASS Rose waits for the glasses to connect -- it reads “IDLE - Attempting to connect.”
Cate stands over the computer -- waiting for the scan to in -- it reads “IDLE” -- but the screen goes blank.
Where'd it go?
I’m not sure. Debbie hits the side of the screen like an old TV. Then s starts shaking the flat-screen.
Chill. That’s not gonna help. (cooly) No signal. They must be too far underground.

They walk toward the necklace. The titanium case is opene It is truly breathtaking. Rose approaches, touching her glasses as if wiping away tears -- but really trying to s the necklace. ROSE’S POV - NECKLACE - THROUGH THE GOOGLE GLASS She can’t transmit a scan -- “CONNECTION LOST.” Rose turn her head so Amita can glimpse the back of the lens. “CONNECTION LOST”.
This seems very secure down here -- TIFFANY’S ASSOCITE Five feet of solid concrete.
Trying to figure out what they’re going to do --
You said you wanted to see it in the light.  53.
This is light --
(getting it) Oh. No, we need real light. (gaining steam) The red carpet happens while the sun is still out. So -- if you --
And your boss --

.».-Right. Your boss. If you want thousands of pictures to be taken of this necklace on the neck of Daphne Kluger and every reporter writing TIFFANY’S in big block letters -- we need to know what it will look like. In sunlight.
Real sunlight.
Otherwise we’re wasting our time.

Large windows near the ceiling let in beautiful, cascadin natural light. Armed Guards enter first, carrying the necklace under a covering cloth. Rose and Amita follow. The guards set the necklace down, remove the covering cloth and open the cas Rose and Amita stand over it. Rose adjusts her glasses --
(a beat) Come on... ROSE’S POV - NECKLACE - THROUGH GOOGLE GLASS As the service bar kicks back in. “SCANNING...” appears a the top of the frame --
They crowd the computer as it begins to receive the scan Debbie stands over her --  54.
Here we go.
Hell yes.
ROSE’S POV -- NECKLACE -- THROUGH GOOGLE GLASS -- 43% Sca Complete --

How is that light, Ms. Weil? Seen what you need to see? ANGLE ON -- ROSE, standing over the necklace, still, not turning to look at him -- ASSOCIATE (CONT’D) Ms. Weil -- He steps toward Rose, she starts circling the necklace -- ASSOCIATE (CONT’D) Is she okay? ROSE’S POV -- NECKLACE -- THROUGH GOOGLE GLASS -- 79% Sca Complete --
Oh, yes, fine -- this is her process -- sort of like meditation--
Cate awaits the scan -- 96% complete -- Amita and Debbie hover, Debbie’s head shaking, mumbling, threatening the computer --—
Rose still stands over the necklace --
If you’re done, Ms. Weil, we'd like to return this to the vault -- ROSE'S POV - NECKLACE - THROUGH GOOGLE GLASS - 99% Scan Complete.
“SCAN 100%” flashes on Cate’s computer screen. Debbie looks to Cate -- exhales.  55. INT. TIFFANY’S VAULT Rose looks nauseous, like she is about to faint, steadies herself. Amita escorts her out.
A celebratory kick-back. The crew drinks wine, Rose smoke joint, trying to relax. Debbie stands near the computer w Cate. She finishes her whiskey, puts it on the table.
All right, let’s do this. C’mere -- They all gather round the printer. Debbie looks to the cr

Ready? Cate clicks “print” on the computer -- They stand over the 3D printer. A perfect glass replica of the necklace is birthed into a three dimensional life before their eyes. It’s massive, almost a foot long, at least five pounds -- astonishing.

Everyone is good and drunk. The crew is gathered round. CONSTANCE FREESTYLES from the front of the stage as her cohorts look up her from the front row. (NOTE: To be play over footage preparing for the heist.) TAMMY. Teases her about her crush on Debbie and running a side hustle fencing. NINE BALL -- who lives in the dark web. Stealin’ shit we don’t even know about... Then ROSE -- Teases her about dressing like a Wizard of 0 witch. Broomstick etc.. AMITA -- her sister. They both have wrist bands. Where we you last night girl... Amita embarrassed. Leaps from the stage landing in front of... DEBBIE AND CATE -- Her bosses. Bobbsey Twins Boss Bitches salutes the two of them. “Can I have the night off?”
Deb lies on a chaise lounge eyes closed. A shadow crosses over her.
Hello.

Deb and Cate stand at the roulette wheel as total strange Cate dressed stylishly is parked at the end. Deb is highe upon the wheel enthusiastically betting red and black. De downs a cocktail with flourish then calls out for another

Dr. Pepper and Jack please. No ice. Even the waitress is incredulous and nods. The croupier spins the ball. Cate puts two chips on a column bet. The ball falls onto a red number... DEBBIE (CONT’D) YES! Rojo! Awesome! Better red than dead... (and then) Woohooo...
During the commotion past-posts five chips on her column switching out high denominations for low ones. As the croupier goes to pay her, she corrects him.
Actually, those are thousands on the bottom.
An open suitcase, strewn clothes and twenty dollar bills.
Deb watches TV while Cate counts the haul.
Nine thousand and sixty.
(turns) That’s all?
ITALY. (OCEAN’S TWELVE) RESTAURANT - ONE YEAR LATER... Having completed the heist, Danny and his team clink glas It’s a party: laughter, congratulations, poker game, champagne.

head_text.subj: CASINO QUEEN RIVERBOAT AND RESORT. ST LOUIS, MO.

text: Deb and Cate sit in the Paddlewheel Grill near the stern. man in suspenders and arm garters serenades on a banjo.
Did you play with boys when you were little?
Only. (beat) «--You?
Sometimes. He wouldn’t let me most of the time. He’d tell my parents he was watching me and then he’d ditch me.
Let it go, Deb.
Two and a half million dollars. (incredulous) In art.
You said you weren’t gonna read about it.
I read about it. (beat) And what are we doing? We’re grinding it out in shitty casino’s every night. We’ve even run out of casinos. Now we’re in riverboats.
It’s not actually a riverboat.
It floats.
Touché.  58.
We shouldn’t even be here. We should be at Caesars lying in a cabana. (manic) We need something bigger.
No. We don’t need something bigger.
Ido. I need it.
Priceless.
Debbie moves through the art, searching for the right spo she wears a scarf, her hat dipped low, a backpack.
Madame X -- Debbie stares up at it.
Warhol’s Chairman Mao -- Debbie appraises...
Washington Crossing the Delaware -- She looks at the painting -- nods to Amita who peruses th hall. Amita approaches the GUARD.
(unfolding a map) Hi, can you help me with something? I’m a bit lost --
Of course, ma’am.  59.
I feel like I’m walking in circles. So I came from Egypt -- back there...
Mesopotamia --
(fancy) Oh, huh -- (re: map) But now we’re in America... Very confusing.
She takes out her backpack and pulls out what looks like rolled up poster. It shines as if it is made of latex --
No, that’s French Impressionism --

Oh -- I love French Impressionism! (checks the periphery/flirtatious) Must be amazing being around this art all the time. Suddenly, there’s commotion, a crowd surrounding a painti the Guard doesn't know what’s going on.
(To Amita) ‘Scuse me. He runs over. Pushes through the crowd --

A replica of WASHINGTON CROSSING THE DELAWARE has been plastered to the wall -- except all the men in the boat a WOMEN: white, black and Native American. Affixed to the w next to the original -- stunning and surreal.
#banksy #guerillaart #neareverygreatmanisagreatwoman
“Banksy Hits the Met twitterpic”  60. “How much you want to bet the new Banksy piece ends up in permanent collection.” “George Washington was a CHICK!?!"”
This is a major security breech.
Debbie, Cate, and Tammy sit on a bed WEARING HEADPHONES. Nine Ball sits perched in a window pointing a laser mic a building across the street: Looks like a gun -- works lik mic.
(over headphones) He did it at the Tate, too.
A red laser dot appears on the window.
So this is acceptable to you?
Not acceptable. But it’s not like he stole something. He just added something, right? Now you have a Banksy at the Met. Silence.
When we hired you to overhaul the system you said, and I quote, “the redundancy of this system would render any breach...”
I know what it says.
Is this a breach?
Technically.
Well -- this feels kind of technical. (MORE )
(nothing back...) What are you going to about it?
Yeah, douche bag.
Shh.
Obviously, we’ll do a full audit of the system and plug any major holes.
Yesss!
When?
We'll start immediately. Hi-fives all around. INT. CATE’ Nine Ball
has hacked into main security program for the Met. Everyone gathers around her monitor. Nine Ball appear on
Ok, I’m in. Any changes they make we can see and over-write, but they can see our changes too.
Is that a problem?

Not with what we’re changing. They have so much on their plate, they won't even notice. (to Nine Ball) Show ‘em the gallery. clicks a few times and a huge array of cameras the screen. It’s a grid of eighty images.
Wo.
That’s a gallery. But this is the hallway outside the cafe.  62. She nudges Nine Ball who clicks again. Only two images po up.
See -- they’re watching the art. They don’t care about a bathroom.
That’s smart.
All we need is a blind spot in the hall outside the bathroom. Ten feet should do it. Which is nothing compared to the changes they’re gonna be making. (smiles) And it wasn’t even a real Banksy.
A REAL BANKSY. INT. VOGUE MAGAZINE RECEPTION AREA — DAY
Good afternoon, Vogue...
One of the most famous silhouettes in New York sits at he desk. All at once, Anna’s assistant sticks her head in do
What?
That interview? Gala staff position?
Are you serious?
Friend of Harvey's.
Fine. Hire her.

head_text.subj: TAMMY. NOW BEING LED DOWN A HALL

text: ANNA’S ASSISTANT We're really short on desk space right now, so you'll be down here. Tammy glances to her left at a large conference room encl in glass.  63.
There, on the wall, like an object of holy worship is the Ball Seating Chart.
Hurry up.
INT. CATE’S THEATER - NIGHT Tammy enters, tired, lugging down the center aisle.
Ok. This party is nuts... Everyone turns as she heads toward the stage.
I’m not kidding. If Anna thinks your dress is ugly -- you can’t wear it. No shit. She will bar your wardrobe. Can I have a sip of that.
Sure.

Last year she got in a fight with one of the designers two days before the event -- and no one was allowed to wear his clothes! For real. Black-balled. She takes a swig of the water, opens a bag of chips.

Sorry, I haven’t eaten all day. (stuffs some chips) Tables cost a quarter million dollars -- that is, if she decides to let you buy one. Not any $250,000 check is accepted, they literally have to approve your money! Debbie reaches out and wipes a chip crumb from Tammy’s mo Tammy inhales slightly at the touch. Cate looks at Debbie "Stop torturing the poor girl."
Did you get the seating chart?  64.
Oh yeah. Of course. She removes her Google Glasses and dangles them towards Debbie...
Nine ball sits back at the controls. The glasses sit ina charging dock as The Seating Chart appears in front in fr of them. It’s hard not to be impressed.
Wo. Like -- Leo, Leo?
There’s only one Leo, dear.
Elon Musk.
(turns) Really?
I am such a Musk-a-teer.
(slight giggle) Omigod! Taylor Swift.
(joining in/to Amita) You’re so white.
Guys. Please. Where is she?
Table three, four o’clock. It’s the straightest shot to the bathroom without putting her in Siberia.
Great.
Anna signs-off on all of her changes by email, so...
Not a problem. I’ve got her email.  65.
Do you have everyone’s email?
Who do you want?
(points) There’s a blank spot right next to her.
That’s for her date.
Who’s her date?
(quickly) No idea. Shoots a look at Tammy...
A pre-party for the chairs of the Gala -- Daphne is alrea seated at her table. Klaus strolls up, glances down at hi place card. Daphne looks up. Smiles. He takes her hand...
I think they put me next to you.
Lucky me.
Dressed as wait staff watches from a portico. She’s rivet on the introduction.
(kissing her hand) Klaus Gunther -- A hand kiss? Really? Klaus slithers into the chair beside her -- one smooth reptilian move.
DINNER. LATER. TAMMY’S POV Daphne and Klaus laughing, leaning closer, silhouetted by candlelight. Daphne’s voice cuts through...  66.
That's dirty...
“THE SEATING CHART” The blank space next to DAPHNE KLUGER is filled in with t name KLAUS GUNTHER. She has a date now.
She hovers over Nine Ball staring at the newest version o the seating chart. Klaus Gunther...
Cate bursts through the double doors at the back of the theater, flinging them open at once. Debbie is smoking ou back and Cate is on her in a fury.
What the fuck. Really?
(turning) Really what?
You couldn't leave it alone? Klaus Gunther!
That’s not me.
Stop. I’m not a croupier. Ora tourist with a bucket of quarters. Or a hotel manager. Don’t con me. Don’t run a job in a job.
It’s not going to matter.
(re: the others) Shh.
Why do you do this? Why can’t you just do a job? Why does it always need an asterisk?
Frozen. 67.
He sent me to jail.
And he’s gonna do it again.
No, he’s not.
I’m out. Wo.
I mean it. You gave me an off ramp. I’m taking it.
Cate...
You're framing him. It’s not enough to make a gajillion dollars, you have to pin it on him too? Where does it end? This is just like last time.
No it’s not. (panicked) Fine. I wont do it. I’11 call it off.
Oh good. Glad we had this talk. I feel all better now.
I mean it. (then...) You’ve never been in there. You don’t know what it’s like.
And I don’t want to find out.
You won’t. I promise. Deb extends her hand. Leaves it out there for an eternity
(looking up the block) Who's that?  68. She motions toward a Crown Victoria parked at the curb. A man sits at the wheel.
I don’t know. Some guy. Cate reaches out and slowly takes her hand. They shake.
Deb and Cate seated in the restaurant of the cheesy casin
We need something bigger.
No. We don’t need something bigger.
Ido. I need it.
Deb sits across from Klaus Gunther: bleached smile and sSlicked back hair.
So what do I have to do?
KLAUS’ BED He and Debbie (post coital) lie in his sheets.
It’s not really a forgery because we’re not copying any known painting. It’s previously undiscovered work.
Gotcha.
I can’t sign the provenance because they know me but...
It’s still fraud.
That’s not clear.  69.
Cate’s first club. There isn’t much room.
It’s still fraud.
That’s not clear.
I know Klaus Gunther. I’ve known him for ten years.
Oh, yeah. He wants you do it too. He can’t front as the owner because they know him.
I’m sure they do.
The sale goes through his gallery, Cate. He’s on the line too. One signature. Half a million dollars
Yeah. That’ll show your brother.
No. (pointed) That’1ll mean we can stop hitting shitty casinos on the gulf coast.
I’m out.
Fine.
Don’t trust him, Deb.
(smiles) Who said I trust him. INT. CIPRIANI - THIS TIME LUNCH... Deb sits alone waiting for Klaus. Checks her watch. She’s eaten a whole breadbasket. Suddenly...
Are you Deborah Ocean?  70. She looks up...
Deb, dressed in an orange jumpsuit carries bedding toward camera...
Debbie stands in front of her crew -- dressed significant better now. Cate stands off to the side, among the others

Ok, remember -- this is a run- through. It’s where we make mistakes. Nobody panics, this is why we do this. If something happens and you don’t expect it, it’s no big deal. We roll with it, regroup later. (a beat) Any questions?
Constance, as she puts on her Audio Guide, moves through hours at the Met. A little looser and boozier than the normal crowd. Young professionals mill about.
Okay, here we go --

The Mark is the The Hotel of Choice for all Gala attendee our Headquarters for the night -- The new, temporary War Room. A monitor shows a mini version of the Security Hub monitors. Nine ball has hacked into the system.
Places, ladies...

Constance puts her foot up on a bench to tie her shoe, ne to where An ELDERLY MUSEUM-GOER sits. Constance takes off her headset, places it on the bench next to her so she ca pull back her hair. The Elderly Museum-Goer rises, gathers her things and departs. Constance does so a few moments after.  71.
(headset) Constance, go -- get moving -- Constance doesn’t move.
(louder ) I said, “Go!” AN ELDERLY WOMAN... Hears Nine Ball YELLING at her in the Met Audio Guide. Sh taps her headphones.
Looks equally perplexed:
Who's Winslow Homer? The Elderly Museum-Goer is next to her -- hearing Nine Ba shouts growing more obscene.

Is it supposed to be interactive? Why is this painting yelling at me? Constance looks at the bewildered museum-goer, realizes t headsets have been switched. She takes the REAL one from Elderly Woman’s hand. Back on track.
Okay, okay, I’m here.
(on the headset) Back to one. Like you’re coming out of the bathroom. She hurries over to the door of the women’s bathroom.
Move. Constance emerges and passes Debbie just outside the bathroom. She hands her a string of Mardi Gras beads as a stand-in for the necklace.
Takes off the other direction moving through the gallery.
Legit.  72.
Debbie keeps moving past George Bellows, Thomas Hart Bent Eakins, then slows...
Saul? She stops. Turns. Saul Bloom (Carl Reiner) is admiring a painting by William Merrit Chase. She moves closer. He turns as if surprised.
Oh! My goodness. I can’t believe it! Hello -- you look gorgeous.
What are you doing here?
You know. Art. I love this guy. Big fan. He motions toward the painting. Deb stands in front of th label describing the painting.
Who's it by?
Aw, c’mon. Don’t do that. I care about you. Is that a sin?
When you meddle. Yes.
I'm a 90 year old Jew. Meddling is all that’s left. She starts to leave.
Wait! He shuffles to keep up with her. Takes her arm...
Can we sit down? Saul is a little out of breath. They sit on the padded benches in front of the paintings. Saul’s wipes some swea with a handkerchief.
This isn’t going to work.  73.
You don’t know that. He winces -- an expression of Jewish doubt. Sucks air through his teeth.
Why are you still listening to my brother, Saul? He’s dead.
He loved you. He didn’t want you to go to jail.
He had no idea who I was.

Oy. (kids) You can’t argue with a dead person sweetie. My Sadie? I argued with her for years. I’d even go out to the cemetery. You know how crazy that looks -- an old man yelling at tombstone? (pats her hand) Leave it.
I have.
(looks around the museum) No, you haven't.
This has nothing to do with him.
Ok. Come out to the house sometime. We can play cards.
No way. I’ve played cards with you.
Then we can have some smoked fish.
Deal. She leans over and kisses him on the cheek. Saul smiles. pats her hand.  74.
(lower) If you want to fight with somebody, those guys tailing you are good place to start.
(a whisper) The one’s in the Crown Vic?
(impressed) Yeah. (beat) You might be ok after all. He pushes himself up and heads off into the museum.
A Crown Victoria sits parked on 80th Street.

head_text.subj: ACROSS THE STREET. EDGE OF THE PARK

text: Debbie stands in the shadow of a food cart looking at it.
Two men sit at the windshield of the car looking across a the met. Deb turns and heads off into the park... EXT. CENTRAL PARK — LATER The team is already meeting when Debbie arrives. Cate approaches.
What happened to you?
Took the long way.
How’s Saul?
Worried.
Me too.
We're fine.
The girls are waiting. I got them all ice cream.  75. Deb nods. Heads off down the path. Cate hesitates...
A rental car rolls through industrial detritus.
In the distance we see Cate talking to the owner demonstrating what looks to be the outline of a box with hands. She mimes the dimensions. Roughly two by three...
Cate signs an agreement for a plain white panel truck. INT. FISHING STORE - RUSTY’S BAIT AND TACKLE She stands at the counter buying reels of monofilament fishing line.
Cate is in line buying six large iPhones.
Debbie wanders out into the fading light to see the Crown Victoria parked down the block.

Deb crosses to the car and is just about to confront them when she looks up to see... Cate, rounding the corner from the other direction. They pause at the car, smile at each other. Deb taps on the window and they roll it down slowly.
(leaning in) Hey guys. This is my friend Cate. We’re gonna be in for most of the night so if you want to run out and grab a bite or something it’s fine. Cate smiles. Nods.
And if you need a bathroom just knock on the door. There's a good Lebanese place round the corner. The girls turns and head toward the theater.
Where you been?  76.
Odds and ends. As they head inside.
Over Manhattan. Sunlight peeks over the park.
The Silver Carpet cascades down the front stairs of the M

The MET itself is in WARDROBE PREP -- WORKERS string up thousands of yards of lights -- FLOWERS trucked in -- roses, hydrangeas, peonies. STAFF arrange tables and chairs -- The PRESS STAND is raised -- ASSISTANTS affix seat labels each news outlet in order of importance.

INT. CATE’S THEATER - EARLY AFTERNOON A silent ritual. Everyone moves around preparing their pi of the puzzle. A couple of them wear ear buds, in the zon EXT. TIFANNY’S HEADQUARTERS - MORNING An armored car (BRINKS) waits with the engine running. TW GUARDS carry a large-strong box with the HARRINGTON neckl in it.

Daphne walks in dressed in heels and lingerie, hair in curlers, drinking whiskey. She sits in a Director’s chair a team of make-up people go to town. A MANICURIST takes h hand, another works on her feet --
Six women (Rose is missing), are dressed to the nines in front of a wall mirror. Finishing touches are applied: ha tweaks, mascara, re-applied lipstick...  77.
The BRINKS truck arrives in the front of the hotel.
Rose stands at the elevator doors looking up at the floor indicator. As it descends toward her she grows more and m nauseous, stifling a gag as the doors opens...
Daphne, now in a robe, is getting her hair sprayed, her e shadow blended. She glances in the mirror in front of her see Rose and two men in suits behind her.

Is that it? Rose nods and stands to the side. The two guards from Tiffany’s move into the room, carrying a large velvet jew box. There is a weird ceremony to all of this: the place goes quiet; the men march forward in an even cadence. Ros crosses behind Daphne as the Harrington is revealed...
Holy shit.
She reaches forward and opens the top of Daphne’s robe, revealing the nape of her neck. Rose puts the Harrington around her neck and fastens the clasp: it sounds like tumblers clicking.
Might be a little cold.
And heavy. The mirror glitters -- it’s almost celestial.
(deep breath) Ok. Let’s get this off and get you dressed. She reaches up and starts to fiddle with the clasp which doesn’t seem to open.
Oh -- can’t get it off like that. He steps forward pulling out a small pen like cylinder.  78.
Special clasp. Needs this magnet. Titus crosses behind her and fits the device over the cla He gives it a half turn and the necklace unlocks.
She is somewhere between ashen and light green. Rose take quick shallow gasps clutching the arm of the chair.
Oh that’s... Brill--iant. (forced smile) Let me see that again. Titus, full of pride fastens the clasp, then shows the sm magnetic cylinder like a magician demonstrating a trick.

Takes in all of this from the mirror. The necklace. Titus behind her... and behind him Rose who steadies herself wi one hand, clutching her iPhone in the other. DAPHNE’S POV. ROSE’S IPHONE (TIGHT) She points it at the back of Daphne’s neck.
The women have loaded most of a white panel truck and are about to head out when Debbie gets a text.
She turns the same color as Rose. Motions for Cate.
What?
Not... (tries to swallow) ...Good.
Of Titus’ hand turning the clasp.
(on the video) “See it’s the magnet that does it.”  79.
Nine ball’s little sister Veronica (15 years old) is capturing a Pokemon Go character on her fire escape. Her phone rings, interrupting the capture.
Goddamn it.
Hey.
I was about to catch a Rhyhorn, Leslie. What do you want?
They huddle around a speaker phone.
(turns) Leslie?
I'll kill you. (to her sister) We're in a jam, sis. Need your help.
Veronica has an array of magnets spread over the seat bes her. She tries to look at the shaky video, speaking to Ni Ball on the speaker phone.
I think I got it. Just a magnet with double A battery. I'’11 give her a positive and a negative pole so she can flip around when she’s using it.
Cate drives. Everyone hangs on the conversation.
(into phone) Awesome, V.
Really? She fixed it? Nine Ball shoots a look: “of course she fixed it.”  80.
(suddenly points) Whoa! THEIR POV. THE MET... The bleachers are in place, the carpet out, spotlights positioned, cameras everywhere -- it looks almost regal.

The elevator doors open to reveal -- Daphne who looks STUNNING in a long-sleeve black velvet d that hugs every curve. A twelve foot train, and a plungin neckline frame the world's most valuable necklace.
The van screeches to a halt. Debbie bolts from the passengers door. Veronica does the same looking for her sister when she hears a loud whistle...
Veronica appears jogging through a children’s playground Stan Smiths and a vintage flower dress. She runs up to De and her sister.
That shit is hectic over there. Got chased by a cop.
This is my sister, Veronica.
(smiles) Hey. Veronica hands her the magnet.
Very tight. I owe you.
Just get me a new ID. And she jogs away.
What do your parents do?  81.
The bleachers are in place, the carpet out, spotlights pi the heavens.
THOUSANDS of them, refracting off the silver carpet.
The dress somehow looks more radiant on the silver carpet with the full-effect of the train --
On her arm. Looks like just another accessory, albeit a handsome one. The FLASHES go even crazier. He steps aside to allow...
-- her moment in the limelight. She basks (nervously) as name “ROSE WEIL” ECHOES over the PA system --
Is in deep BG, following Rose, following Daphne.
(into her earpiece) You got the paste?
(replying) Copy. She is dwarfed by the Necklace’s security guards -- JUDAS Titus.
Steaming shawarma wafts through the air. The outside is decorated with glossy laminated photos of their cuisine.
Nine Ball is set up with a full console of monitors, a wo station and headphones.
With each arriving LIMO there is a bigger and more beauti
Sarah Jessica Parker in Oscar de le Renta, Rihanna in Alexander Wang, Taylor Swift in Prada, Kim Kardashian and Kanye West in Balmain. Haute Couture Mayhem -- as the cameras and crowds go wild
Exiting her limo, looking pretty damn amazing in her own gown, but no one takes much notice of her. It’s a pretty dress. No twelve foot train, but way better than an orang jump suit.
It’s been transformed. The huge entrance hall is now the grandest ballroom in the world. Debbie scans the famous faces finally settling on...
Now a glamorous couple. All Deb’s own doing and still it stings.
Nine Ball eats a falafel at the same time. Cate hovers behind her buttoning a chef's toque. She stares at the monitors.
Places check --
Doing final checks over the tables, speaks into her heads
Ready to sit --
At full steam in the Costume Exhibit -- The party-goers move down four mirrored hallways, passing glass cases that show off --  83.
Rubies, diamonds and emeralds from the House of Worth, Chanel, Dior, Givenchy... DAPHNE AND KLAUS... Stroll through the exhibit.
She watches them.

Utterly unfazed, they pause in front of: A matte black infinity. The room looks like it extends fo football field. The black sky is punctuated by FLOATING JEWELS -- each their own supernova: Diamonds, sapphires, rubies, emeralds, they gleam as if emitting their own lig They float in space, suspended from the ceiling, each describing an invisible human form. It’s like Yayoi Kusam Infinity room but way cooler and A LOT MORE EXPENSIVE. A million dots of light into infinity -- a celestial wonder
Cate watches THE MONITOR, where Klaus Gunther leans over whispers something to Daphne who throws her head back in peel of laughter. Cate doesn't react. She turns and leaves.

On the stage at the front of the hall, a jazz quartet pla The room fills with slightly lubricated guests. Everyone migrates toward their seats, appraises dresses they’ve ye see, people with whom they haven’t schmoozed -- TAMMY OBSERVES... DAPHNE AND KLAUS: a suprisingly-great-first-date energy between them. They move to their table -- ROSE... Already sits, enjoying her second glass of wine. Daphne a Klaus take their place next to her. (Top designers are always seated next to the “designed.”) CONSTANCE... Does a pass by of the table -- glances down at the clasp.  84.
It’s sitting in the middle of Daphne’s neck like the whee a safe.

Clutches the small “pen light” magnet, practicing -- work it in her fingers. She drifts off into the party... ON THE OTHER SIDE OF THE PARTY... Debbie hasn’t taken her eyes off of Daphne and Klaus. He leans in and whispers to Daphne, half nibbling her ear. Whatever.
Nine Ball watches Klaus still nibbling Daphne’s ear on th monitor. It’s gross even in low res video.
Okay, we're ready. Countdown -- in
Cate now dressed in her toque, turns to a waiter:
Table 3: we need a vegan and a plain broiled fish... (as if a throw-away) Where’s the soup for table one?
Over here. She sees the bowls lined up --
Cate pulls the small brown bottle from her pocket.

head_text.subj: TIGHT ON A BOWL OF SOUP

text: We move with the steaming (now spiked) bisque through the greatest party in the world. Gliding by peripherally on t EDGES OF THE FRAME are glimpses of: Selena Gomez, Michael Jordan, Megyn Kelly, Laverne Cox, Neil Patrick Harris etc
Where Klaus is, not surprisingly, holding court.  85.
.-.-But then again, I’ve always been a keen admirer of the female form.

Huh? The Soup lands in front of Daphne. DAPHNE KLUGER (CONT’D) Oh, thank God. She grabs her spoon and instead of bringing cutlery to mo she reverses the process, nearly plunging into the steami bowl. Daphne is four spoons deep before she ever breathes DAPHNE KLUGER (CONT’D) (re: her dress) I haven't eaten in three days. She wipes her soup moustache with the back of her hand an plunges back in.
No one else is eating. Klaus stares at Daphne’s mouthful soup bread --
(yeah, dickhead, I’m hungry) What? Judas and Titus stand on the outskirts of the Temple.
(into headset) She's in deep. Maybe half a bowl.
Nine Ball watches the scene on her monitors --
Alright everybody. Here it comes. INT. WOMEN’S BATHROOM All done up with fancy table stands offering beauty produ and mints and floral arrangements.
Blows into the room.
We're up.  86. INT. TEMPLE OF DENDUR - DAPHNE’S TABLE

So I have three brothers right -- totally vicious growing up. They would plan it out -- like pinto beans the night before, then in the morning two of them would hold me down while -- whoa. Daphne holds her stomach. The digestion is audible -- DAPHNE KLUGER (CONT’D) ...Cause you know -- brothers can be... (audible stomach rumble) God DAMN. All at once Daphne bolts from the table flailing in searc a bathroom. Judas and Titus follow suit.
Into her headset...
Game on.
Makes for the bathroom as well.
Daphne elbows a MATRON out of the way just as --
Converges on the bathroom door. She wedges herself betwee Daphne and Titus, who follows a step behind her. DEBBIE. Excuse me. He starts to push past her.
I beg your pardon. That’s the ladies room. She plants herself between Titus and the door...
Looking down at her monitor. No Deb.  87.
That’s good... You’re right in the blind spot.
Daphne barrels into the door, hand over mouth -- She flings open the door to reveal Constance about to sit the toilet -- all according to plan.
Oh, my --

As Daphne removes her hand, a torrent of vomit flows into toilet -- the noise is loud and painful, as if her stomac being excavated. After several wretches, Constance soothes her, strokes Daphne’s hair. The side of her cheek. The back of her neck...

There, there -- Another wretch. CONSTANCE (CONT’D) You poor thing. TIGHT. CONSTANCE’S HAND. SLOW MOTION She pops the magnet out of her glove and fits it deftly o the clasp. A half twist and it doesn’t move.

She lifts into frame bilious, gasps, then disappear all o again, hurling. RESUME. EXTREME CLOSE UP. CONSTANCE’S HAND She flips it around from the positive to the negative pol and fits it over the clasp. A half turn and the SOUND OF TUMBLERS .
The Harrington comes loose falling out of frame...  88.
As a necklace falls, Constance deftly catches it...
Constance bolts inside, starts wiggling out of her gown..
Still looking at her bank of monitors.
Ten seconds.
Grabs a bus boy who is carrying a tray of dirty dishes.
Don’t dawdle. Get that stuff into the kitchen. And she guides him along the wall right past...
Where Constance exits, now wearing a server’s uniform, he hair pulled back. She moves past Debbie, crosses paths wi the busboy and deftly slips the Harrington Necklace into pile of dirty dishes.
Takes it all in...

Nothing on the cameras. Then, the bus boy appears (emergi from the blind spot) carrying a tray of dirty dishes. Non of the women are anywhere to be found. TRACKING SHOT. WITH BUS BOY... He glides down the hall on his way to the kitchen where..
Waits for him.
Nine ball is charting is progress on the overhead monitor  89.
Almost there...
As he heads toward the kitchen, then suddenly sees a frie and_stops.
Another busboy having deposited dirty dishes, pauses to gossip in the hallway.
Dude. Gigi Hadid? Did you see that dress?
Did you see Emily Rata-whatever. That’s insane.
Cate waits near the entrance to the loading dock looking toward the door. She leans into her headset.
(whisper) Where is he? What’s wrong?
Hears the chatter on her headset.
What’s going on?
Nine Ball leans into the monitor.
They're stalled in the hallway. Chatting. TAMMY... Hears it and takes off toward the kitchen. She catches up the busboy carrying a tray of dirty dishes and a hundred million dollar necklace.
What the hell are you doing!
Sorry.  90.
You're not getting paid to talk. Get in there.
As he heads up the hallway into...
Steam. Shouting. Rattling plates. But where Cate was standing, now, there is...
Cate is gone. The busboy enters looking for a dish washin station.
(over the headset) Anybody got eyes on Cate?
Here! I’11 take those.
Amita is scouring the cutlery dressed as a dishwasher. Th bus boy dumps his tray into her sink and heads back towar the party.
She reaches into the soapy water and fishes around throug the slime. All at once she stops; knows that feeling. Ami fishes 150 million dollars out of the goop.
It’s covered with gunk but still glistens. Amita grabs th overhead nozzle and rinses off the Harrington necklace un it gleams.
She sticks it into her pocket and calls out to the rest o the kitchen.
Bathroom break!
Amita crosses to the bathroom and locks the door behind h  91.

Single toilet. Sink. Tampon dispenser. Changing table. Amita draws a long breath and takes out the Harrington. W Then she opens the tampon dispenser, displaying a full ar of jewlers tools, neatly organized and fastened.
Dope. She grabs the loupe and slips it on her head, then turns opens the changing table: a work bench.
Nine ball is scanning the various images.
(into headset) Where’s Cate. Anybody? Need eyes on Cate.
Debbie is still loitering outside the door. Feels like forever. She glances at Titus then back at her watch...
(to Nine Ball/in headset) Forget her. Stay focused.
You’re avoiding me. Debbie turns to see... TAMMY standing next to her.
(beat) What?

(presses close) Seriously. We were going to talk when I started, and then there was so much to get ready for, and then when I wanted to have a bigger conversation you said everyone was around and we needed time if we wanted to have a “real” talk. So TI thought great she wants to have a “real” talk, but...  92.
Can we just do this later?
That’s all you ever say.
(whispers) Like a hundred million dollars later?
There’s never a good time.
Honestly Tam, there are better times than this.
Ok. And she walks away shaken but proud of herself for having such an important, if difficult, conversation.
Daphne comes out, pale green -- very pale. Wipes her mouth...
That was gnarly.
Looks relieved -- then not... HIS POV. CLOSE UP. DAPHNE KLUGER’S DECOLLETAGE The Harrington Necklace is missing.
(feeling their stares) What? One of them (gently) grabs her. The other pushes past her into the bathroom --

She has removed the first diamond from the Harrington and holds it up to her loupe. Slight gasp.  93. EDGE OF THE DINING ROOM... Debbie watches the panic build. Daphne is surrounded by a security team who escort her back to the table.

I’m not sure. It could have fallen off back here. Or maybe in there... I don’t know, I just barfed an organ out... The phalanx moves toward the table. Walkie-talkies crackl More security descend on the room.
Are you alright? Oh, you poor dear.
What’s going on? What happened?
It must have fallen off, or --
(seeing the missing necklace) Are you joking with me?
(approaching) Nothing in the bathroom --
Jesus.
Maybe a spot of tea...
They're sealing the exits.
Exits being sealed now. Amita?
(on the headset) Two earrings and a bracelet. We're five minutes ahead.
Cool.
And they're nice.
(checks the monitors) Excellent. Sweeping the room.
The entire party is being guided into the foyer by securi guards.
Most of the guests have been cleared out leaving the plac weirdly empty -- a restaurant at closing time. Daphne and Klaus are talking to security while people search the pla
(to the crowd) I am just so sorry... (a distinction) For real.
It’s completely empty. Silent. Glistening. Now it does look like outer space...
A GALA ORGANIZER speaks into a wireless microphone.

(too close -- feedback) Um -- we apologize for this interruption but -- someone has misplaced a rather expensive item and they tell us we’re going to have to stay here while they search. I’ve told them this needs to happen quickly so I’m sure it will. I’m confident that we will all be back to dessert shortly.
