As the security teams furiously searches, Tammy is perche the far side of the room --
She whispers into her headset --
They’re at table three, seven and ten. Still a crowd around table one. Give it a second.  95.
Rodger that. Super chill.
It has been combed over. Several of the security team gla at each other. Nothing. They move on to table two...
Amita works furiously. She’s already fashioned four sets earrings, three rings, two necklaces. She works on a bracelet. A POUND at the door --
(calling out) I’m oc-u-pied... She stares down at the completed bracelet in her hand.
Security guards use handheld metal detectors to comb thro the waitstaff --
Once you’ve been checked, please head toward the far exit -- The kitchen staff begins to clear out. Still no Cate.
CONSTANCE comes blowing through the entrance and slams in
Who is heading in the other direction. CLOSE UP. SLOW MOTION... Constance’s left hand deftly slips the PASTE (THE ONE FRO THE 3D PRINTER) into Tammy’s hand --
Nine Ball speaks into her headset.
All going down. Police coming, Tiffany’s coming. Bunch of news reporters coming. Shit’s blowin’ up.  96.
Daphne sits at her table, stunned.
Ms. Kluger -- was there anything you did or anyone you talked to between your table and the bathroom?
I was barfing.
I understand that. Do you remember still having the necklace when you were seated at...
Oh my god! (loud, eager)
They turn. TAMMY... Pulls the necklace from a crease in the table cloth holdi up the necklace (PASTE) like a trophy.
Thank fucking God.
It was under the tablecloth -- ina crease. In the table. You know where they fold... (re: security) Maybe you just didn’t see it the first time or something...
(into his earpiece) We got it back.
Amita cleans up her workstation -- she wears a new pair o BRILLIANT earrings. A knock on the door. Amita opens it.
Slides in the bathroom.  97.
(sees the jewels) Wo. Sick. Constance starts pocketing the rest of the new jewelery.
Be careful. There’s glue. Constance nods (sure whatever). Slips out of the room whi is now just... A bathroom.
Nine Ball emerges from her falafel stand wearing couture. She heads across the street toward the Met.
Daphne now stands on the stairs above the main hall, whil Klaus (gallantly) places the necklace around her neck.
If I may... Cameras flash, seizing upon the intimate moment.
Thank you, Ms. Kluger, for the excitement. (a beat, to the crowd) Let's finish the party, shall we. Everyone files back in -- calm, bonded by the trauma, joy a little less formal and more fun --
As she moves through the party... Past Tammy... Past Rose pounding down a last glass of champagne... Past Nine Ball who is now a radiant partygoer.... Finally face to face with DEBBIE...
Constance pretends to trip, grabs onto Debbie momentarily
Oh, sorry. ‘Scuse me. Constance catches her balance and moves on.  98.
Looks down at a gorgeous diamond necklace in her hand.
Tony Bennett and Lady Gaga perform “Diamonds Are a Girl's Best Friend.” The entire party is happy and boozed up.
Constance exits the Museum, back in her ball gown -- hot pink, strapless, and satin -- now adorned with a beautifu diamond pendant and matching earrings --
Amita, too, has changed into a ball gown -- Deep purple offset by diamonds and emeralds that dangle from her ears
Nine Ball emerges in an impeccable satin tuxedo with a massive ring and matching necklace.
Tammy descends. Forest green a-line dress -- a strand of diamonds looped twice around her neck.

Rose swaggers out, a little loose and loving it -- a_new diamond choker gracing her neck. Debbie floats down the steps -- wearing her new necklace chain choker in the front and a long drop chain cascading down her backless dress.
No Cate. Debbie checks her watch. Glances around. Is just about to check it again when she looks up...
Transformed, descending the stairs in a bright yellow bal gown wearing long dangling diamond earrings. She locks ey with Debbie. Slight nod.
Neon signs in the window, “ATM,” “COFFEE,” “OPEN.” The be on the door ring -- Amita enters, sits at the counter. Sh looks at the menu. Constance enters --

Just one -- She takes a seat a couple stools down from Amita. Nine Ba arrives, nods to the other women, sits. Tammy enters, sti scrolling on her phone. Rose comes, still wasted.  99. She tries to play the claw-game -- but she hasn’t put in money. She finds her way to the counter --
Oh, helloooo. Debbie and Cate enter together, taking the two middle sea They all wear the jewels as they look up and smile.
It looks Edward Hopper’s Nighthawks but instead of normal patrons there are eight women wearing over 200 million dollars in jewelry.

INT. TIFFANY’S VAULT - DAY The two large Security Guards carry the box down the hall toward the waiting associate. ANGLE ON - THE ASSOCIATE’S FACE As he lifts the lid. He wears a loupe. He takes the necklace up in his hand, inspects in under the light -- And nearly PASSES OUT --

An old-school yellow cab screeches up. JOHN FRAZIER, late 40's, Men’s Warehouse suit from his ye trip to the Hackensack outlet, salt-of-the-earth, exits. inhales, looks around, heads in. INT. TIFFANY’S CONFERENCE ROOM - LATER The Tiffany’s Associate sits at the table, shaking, givin into the fact that even in his worst nightmares he could conjure up the circumstance which he is now experiencing.
So you're certain the necklace in your possession is a paste? TIFFANY’S ASSOCIATE (shudders) Yes.
And when did you last see what you believe to be the authentic item?  100. TIFFANY’S ASSOCIATE Last night, in Ms. Kluger’s suite.
Now Larry -- may I call you Larry? TIFFANY’S ASSOCIATE Lawrence --

My experience is, sooner or later people want to be rewarded for their patience. (takes out a toothpick, picks with vigilance) A necklace that’s been sitting ina vault for 30 years isn’t doing anyone any good. Nobody’s seen it, no one even knows what it is. But you place that necklace on a very well-known young lady, on an evening where said placement gets lots of play and attention and all of sudden everyone and their mother knows about that necklace. That necklace becomes very famous, very quickly -- right? TIFFANY’S ASSOCIATE Yes...

And then if that necklace goes missing? John grabs every daily paper from his bag, throws them on table -- all the headlines are about the NECKLACE. JOHN FRAZIER (CONT’D) Well what else would people talk about? That’s a tale of scandal and intrigue that gets people talking and buying. (almost whispers) And what they don’t know is it is insured for $270 million -- so now you're up a quarter billion dollars, your name’s in everyone's mouth, and you’re missing a little necklace that no one had ever seen anyway. You get the publicity and the money. TIFFANY’S ASSOCIATE Are you accusing us --  101.
Merely floating a theory -- (smiles) That's my job. See if it were me, I'd do it early in the night. Get it off our hands quick. TIFFANY’S ASSOCIATE What are you suggesting?

Speculating. That it wasn’t the real necklace to begin with. That someone swapped it out before it even went on Ms. Kluger’s neck -- TIFFANY’S ASSOCIATE I guarantee the necklace on Ms. Kluger’s neck when she left that hotel was the real one -- John Frazier shrugs.
So tell me again how you remember it.
INT. TIFFANY’S CONFERENCE ROOM - LATER John stands in front of four massive cloth covered boards he has transformed the Conference Room into Ground Zero f his investigation.

They put the necklace on me, I did my silly walk, we saw the exhibit, I ate my soup, hurled my guts out -- The necklace was gone, everyone freaked out and then they found the necklace again. Frazier takes the clothes off the boards behind him -- th reveal Daphne’s entire night reconstructed with images fr Getty, Buzzfeed, Instagram, Paparazzi and Security footag In most of the images, Klaus is standing right next to he
Thank you, Ms. Kluger. Fortunately, I’ve been able to trace every step of your night as relying on your memory would be -- well -- less dependable considering your level of refreshment. (MORE )
So as you can see in all of these photos, there is a young man standing next to you -- Mr. Klaus Von Gunther?
He was my date --
(amazed) Is that his real name?
I have no idea.
German?
Austrian.
Six o’ one. Was there ever a time when you two were alone while you were wearing the necklace? Daphne locks eyes with him --
Passionately making out against a wall in a dark corner o Gallery --
INT. CONFERENCE ROOM - TIFANY’S - RESUME
No. John looks over the images of Klaus and Daphne -- he is touching her neck a lot, as if coveting the necklace. Joh sits on the edge of the table --
Do you suspect he would have any motivations to take the necklace?
I try not to guess about people’s motivations. They tend to show you.  103.

That's a sufficiently vague answer. (beat -- looks at the board) You know, I have every minute accounted for except five -- He looks down at a sheet of paper on the table -- JOHN FRAZIER (CONT’D) Well, four minutes, 48 seconds to be exact.
I was probably rubbing one out.
They said you were charming. (beat) Funnily enough, the unaccounted for minutes do line up with when you were disposed by your sickness.
When I was throwing up?
Was there anyone in the bathroom with you at the time?
My head was at the bottom of a toilet bowl.
How bout after --
Lots of people.
I mean in the bathroom.
Don’t you have cameras in there?

Sadly no. Legal thing. Whoever took this necklace is pretty smart and probably a woman. Or someone dressed as such. Or maybe this German fellow but that’s a bit of a reach. He lays out photos of Daphne with Rose, Tammy, and Debbie the background -- they are zoomed in or from the edges of photos of her -- the cobbling together took a long time.  104. JOHN FRAZIER (CONT’D) Do you know any of these women?

That’s Rose Weil, she designed my gown, which you obviously know, that chick was some type of event planner, I think, and her -- I’ve never seen before in my life. INT. CATE’S THEATER - DAY The team dismantles their headquarters. The replica of th main exhibit still stands in the background. Everyone glances up at the sound of heels clicking against the woo the stage...

You guys are fucked. She enters from stage right and wanders over to a large investigation board -- DAPHNE KLUGER (CONT’D) Wow. It’s like everyone watched Homeland and got ideas -- Photos of Klaus and Daphne throughout the night -- he see enamoured with the necklace. DAPHNE KLUGER (CONT’D) (re: the board) Can I keep this?
You're trespassing.
We asked her to come. Daphne grabs an apple from the table and plops (crash-lan on the couch. All eyes turn to Debbie and Cate.
(deep breath) I realized about a week ago that Ms. Kluger...
Wasn’t a total fucking idiot.
Might have gotten a sense of what we were doing.  105.
The big guy and bald guy are parked outside Cate’s Wareho A knuckle raps on the window. It rolls down to reveal --
Who extends a folded note.
Chuck. Victor. Hi. Could you take this to your boss please. I’d like a word with her.
Daphne drinks something green as she reads Deb’s note.
And there’s some paparazzi outside too, Ms. Kluger.
(engrossed/reading the note) Shh.
The rest of the women pay rapt attention.
So we figured the only way this might work was to take her into our confidence. Daphne takes a huge bite of her granny smith.
(mouthful) I even threw up for real.
You were in the whole time?
Recently.
(preens ) One take, baby.
And it seemed to us -- that eight shares of a hundred and thirty million are better than seven shares of nothing. Right?  106.
It sinks in to the whole group. Awkward silence.
Wo. Chilly. (beat) “Hi Daph, welcome to the team.” Let’s not all high five at once. (another bite of apple) Plus, I’m the one who’s saving your ass from insurance fraud.
Insurance fraud?
I was getting to that.
When?
It seems that RGI has assigned an investigator who...
Is about to look up your ass with a flashlight.
(panicked) Who's this?
Little Colombo dude. Totally onto you. Everything but the trench- coat. Do you guys have anything to drink?
Alright... Lest we forget. This... This entire... “enterprise” was to keep me out of jail.
Nobody's going to jail. We expected this. We’re very prepared.
Looks like it.
WE are not going to be the prime suspects.  107.
I'd go to jail with you, Deb.
Well that’s very nice but...
Who are the prime suspects?

That German creep who sent her away. (beat) Don’t you watch any movies -- like Double Indemnity? These insurance guys are smart. You gotta frame somebody else. Cate and Deb exchange a look. Moment of truth. Beat...
Of course you do. Deb nods. Daphne kicks off her shoes, putting her bare fe on the coffee table.
I know I look like Daphne Kluger, but I only play her in real life. (beat) So when do we sell this shit?
Deb sits at a table near the back. Saul approaches with a WOMAN.
Rene, this is Deborah, Deborah this is Renee.
Hello.
Rene is a very talented actress. (beat) As are her friends. With all that implies.
(grand dame) Hello darling.  108.

Well, I’1ll leave you two. (winks ) Nice goin’ kid. INT. PRESIDENT’S OFFICE - DAY Rene meets with the lead APPRAISER. She’s dressed like a Waspy Jessica Rabbit. The appraiser wears a loupe, inspec the ring -- he is astonished --
Stunning -- it may be the most flawless diamond I have ever seen. This was your mother’s?

Left to me after her passing. “Rene -- the ring is yours.” Quite sappy, really. A Swedish Prince gave it to her while she was traveling in Europe as a young woman. In exchange for her “deflowering,” one can only assume. The Appraiser smiles -- examines it -- thinks...
Well, next week’s auction is our premiere event of the season. It would be hard to take on a single item.
Of course, we’re happy to pay the full commission. He looks up... Smiles.
On the phone --
(into the phone) Working like a charm.
ETHEL, a similar high class dowager, sits opposite the sa Appraiser. She’s been weeping.
Parting with something like this. It’s so hard.  109.
I’m sure --
We were on the deck of the Queen Mary -- North Atlantic in the moonlight. (stifles a sob) Then he says, “I'd give you those stars if I could...” Oh well...
Sits in the same chair as he examines a flawless bracelet

(eastern European) What does a refugee have? What you can put in your pocket. “Take this,” my mother said. “Now go.” So we ran. Istanbul, Vienna, finally London. I put it ina drawer forever but... what’s forever?
It’s a beautiful piece.
Those are her initials right there.
Sits in the same chair, staring intently at a diamond rin which gives Elizabeth Taylor’s a run for its money. She studies it, trying to summon a recollection. She gives up
I just don’t remember. I stare at it and stare at it and I just can’t remember. Is it worth something? The rock is as big as a kumquat --
Um. Yes.
That's nice. I just wish I could remember...
INT. RENE’S APARTMENT The crew of criminally-inclined octogenarians celebrate -  110.
That was fun. CLINK. Rene, Ethel, Marlene, and Diana all touch glasses.
Klaus is walking through the dunes staring earnestly out the horizon, hoping someone is watching him. Unfortunatel someone is.
Ex-cuse me... Klaus turns to see the middle aged man stumbling through sea grass. JOHN FRAZIER (CONT’D) Excuse me...
They sit in a HUGE living room looking out at the beauty wild beach.
Look. You’re gonna have to pronounce your name for me ‘cause...
Klaus... Gunther.
Thank you.
Is that it?

Funny. You’re very funny. Really. Klaus glares. Get on with it. John Frazier opens a folder JOHN FRAZIER (CONT’D) So these are photographs of you with Ms. Kluger. As you can see there are many with your hand on the back of her neck.
I don’t really remember where my hands were.  111.
Ah, to be young. (smiles) Problem is, there’s a missing necklace and a fake in its place. And you’re the one closest to her with the greatest opportunity to...
Why would I want to steal a necklace?
That's what I kept asking myself. When you were on the beach. I kept walking around here going, “why would this guy who has everything, wanna steal a necklace?”
You were in my house?
The door was open.
Do you have a warrant?
(laughs) Gosh no. I work for an insurance company.
Then I think we’re done here. Pause. Tense silence.
(rising) Really. John Frazier nods. Didn’t even finish his Coke.
Could you call me a taxi?
INT. KLAUS’ GALLERY He’s selling a very abstract piece to a couple from Norwa
Exactly. It’s what isn’t there... No one understands negative space like... (MORE )
(his cell phone vibrates) ‘Excuse me --— (answers ) Hello. It’s Daphne --
Oh, hey --

Klaus sitting on a bench. He’s looking down toward the en of the island. Boats glide by. He fights the sun. FROM FAR AWAY... DAPHNE’S SILHOUETTE... Approaches from down-river. She wears a black trench coat cinched at the waist and high heels considering the walk. would make anyone sit up and take notice...
Neon. Car horns. Buses.
Presses her way out of the subway -- fighting through the throng.
Through street vendors and tourists. Every nut imaginable She turns into the blinding light of...
The DING of the door -- she glances around. The HOSTESS stands above a basket of mints --
I’m meeting someone. MOVING WITH HER... Debbie goes up three booths, sits down --
Hello, John.
Hello, Debbie. A long pause.  She takes 113.
I didn’t do this one.
That’s what you said in Philly.
I know. But I didn’t.
(offering) Pickle? one. Crunchy...
Let’s say I knew where part of the necklace was -- hot goods -- totally traceable... Could you get a search warrant?
Don’t know. Depends who’s got it.
Stop fishing. This is me.
Well -- we’d need probable cause.
Of course.
INT. KLAUS’ APARTMENT
Let’s play a game? She's still wearing the trench coat but it’s partially unbuttoned. Her shoes are next to her -- She leans
(struggles to talk) What kind of game?
(sex game) You know. Like a “card” game. in, intoxicating. Klaus shudders slightly...

Cards and underwear are strewn about the bed. Bottle of vodka lies empty. Klaus is in a post-coital coma, the lif sucked out of him. He doesn't know his own name. INT. KLAUS’ CLOSET DAPHNE, wearing his shirt, looks at his dresser. Pictures him. Him and his friends (male). But mainly just him.
All at once, she places a ten thousand dollar bracelet in front of a safari photograph (Klaus shirtless.) Daphne positions her iPhone and CLICK --
Deb takes her phone, shows it to John --
This kind of probable cause?
John looks down at the bracelet on Klaus’ dresser.
Yeah, that works.
INT. KLAUS’ APARTMENT - THE NEXT MORNING 10:03AM on the digital clock. Sunlight invades the blacko shades.
Stirs. Looks at the clock. Looks across the bed. Daphne's gone. He gets up slowly... Needs to pee...
Half a bottle of vodka thunders into the toilet. Klaus stretches, heads into the closet. Pauses.
A note sits next to the bracelet and the photograph...
That’s a lot of diamonds. He picks it up, utterly confuse There is KNOCKING at the front door. It turns to pounding EXT. KLAUS’ APARTMENT Police. Lots of them.
GAVEL pounds. Murmurs die down.
Lot number 63. The Miedenfause Jewels, including a 33.18 D-color internally flawless diamond ring --
In the audience, looking to her companion --
(faintly, lost) Is that one mine?
Bidding will begin at 5 million -- Paddles shoot up in the air -- AUCTIONEER (CONT’D) 5.6 In the front. Do I have 6? Here, yes, to the gentleman in the back. Do I hear five...
The audience as paddles rise until we find --

Perusing the Auction catalogue. She looks up, smiles, as Gavel SLAMS. AUCTIONEER (CONT’D) Sold for 7.9 Million -- As each lot of jewels provided by Rene’s crew get sold -- AUCTIONEER (CONT’D) Sold for 6.7 Million. The gavel SLAMS again.  116. AUCTIONEER (CONT’D) 9.5 Million. The Auctioneer looks like he needs a cigarette.
Klaus sits at a plain wooden table, aghast at his surroundings. A detective stands in front of him.
You have no idea how this came to be in your possession.
None.
But you were Ms. Kluger’s date the night these necklaces were switched.
I was.
Does that strike you as an amazing coincidence?
I think I ought to talk to my lawyer.
(smiles) I think that’s a good idea. INT. CATE’S WAREHOUSE The Crew celebrating -- everyone is drinking. Congratulations all around. Then --
I got a question?
Everyone turns to look at Daphne who is sitting on a crat perplexed. She looks down at her iPhone where she’s been working the calculator.

So you sold ‘bout 35 million worth of jewelry right?  117. Pause. She lowers the phone. DAPHNE KLUGER (CONT’D) How does everyone get 16 million a piece? All eyes on Debbie. They wait to see what she’s going to Ok -- why not?
What? -- You thought we were just going to steal ONE necklace?
Daphne and Klaus stare at the main hall of the exhibit --
On the other side, staring longingly at them. But she wasn’t. Now we know the real of object of her affection: The whole exhibit itself.
See, while everyone was worrying about what was around your neck...
Daphne violently vomits into the toilet.
And you were hurling your brains out -- thank you for that, by the way.
(professional) Of course.
The entire party is escorted out into the main hall --
-- the whole place went into lock down --  118.
Oh, that’s smart.
Cate, in her chef’s uniform, pushes a huge catering cart
Then, when security made us clear out the kitchen -- On the other end of the catering cart is revealed --
Pulling it down the hall -- now wearing a janitors unifor
And everybody was watching the entrance...
The catering cart comes to a stop--
We cleared out too -- just like we were told.
Crosses around to the front of the catering oven and open the double doors revealing... Yen (the chinese acrobat from Ocean’s Eleven) He extends a bright yellow ball gown to her on a hanger.
Thank you.
Why would you steal one necklace when you could steal...
Debbie crosses to the large industrial fridge and swings the door, revealing all the jewels from exhibit.
.--More.
Holy shit.

See, we didn’t just print the Harrington out of that thing. We printed lots of jewels. FLASHBACK. CATE’S LOFT. TWO WEEKS EARLIER. Deb and Amita watch as the 3D printer spits out loads of cubic zirconium.
Felt like I worked at Kinkos.

head_text.subj: BACK AT THE HEIST., (OUTSIDE THE KITCHEN)

text: Yen hops up on the catering cart and gives Cate a hand. S climbs on it as well, putting Yen on her shoulders. Debbi holds the cart as Yen pops open a vent climbing into the ceiling. A moment later, a rope drops down.
How long did you have to do this?
(volunteering) Twelve minutes and thirty eight seconds --
Anna Wintour is making her announcement:
Um -- we apologize for this interruption but -- someone has misplaced a rather expensive item...
Yen, Debbie and Cate crawl through the vent.

Now, when we modified the exhibit, we also changed the background from reflective black to matte black. No big deal, except it was the exact same material our good friend Yen was wearing.  120. We see Yen -- hooded from head to two black lower himself into the exhibit.
So even though he was visible to us from the vent...
The cloaked figure of Yen hangs in space --
He was invisible to the security cameras against the black background...
Watches from her bank of monitors. She sees nothing on he screen.
They all sit mesmerized...
But since it would have been bad to see the jewels move, Nine Ball here helped us customized the cameras.
I just changed the specs a little online.
He takes an iPhone, snaps a picture of the exhibit and sl it into a special housing on the front of the security camera.
Sees a momentary blur then the exhibit looking perfectly normal --
Now all of the jewels are weighted. But when you know the piece, and the exact karats, it’s easy to calculate that weight.
It’s just a little math.  121.

head_text.subj: CATE AND DEBBIE IN THE VENT

text: Loop the fishing line Cate bought at the tackle shop, ove metal roller with a digital pressure meter. Carefully the lower the paste to YEN... Who deftly shifts the weight from one to the other, resto the exhibit. It looks like the jewels move on their own.

So as we reeled down one, we reeled in another. DEBBIE. IN THE VENT... ...-hoists a large bracelet into her hands. First of many INSERT. NINE BALL’S MONITOR On the monitor, Debbie and Cate begin to wheel their “catering cart” nonchalantly toward the truck.
I know you all went through a lot to steal that necklace.

But without a decoy. We never could have done it. INT. COSTUME EXHIBIT — FLASHBACK Cate and Deb wheel the catering cart away from the exhibi toward... EXT. LOADING DOCK — FLASHBACK Cate bangs on the back of a massive truck twice --
Ready. From the driver’s window a small short haired woman peeks -. Ethel the dowager, who sold the first lot of jewels.
All set dear? Cate nods. Ethel honks the horn twice as she drives off. Cate still holds her yellow ball gown.  122. INT. CATE’S WAREHOUSE - PRESENT Debbie motions to all of them a job well done.
And that’s how you all get: Sixteen Million, Five hundred and twenty nine thousand dollars. (smiles) A piece.
Not quite.
Right. We gotta sell ‘em. And Tammy here has recruited a few old friends to help us do that.
Reuben sits in the audience, eating a pretzel with mustar

(in German) The collection is sold! To the gentlemen in front for thirty-eight million dollars. Reuben looks to the GERMAN BUYER, demonstrating the restrained joy of acquisition. Reuben wipes his mouth, ri walks out -- PRELAP: Gavel slamming.
The Auctioneer stands before a group of bidders -- some v conference in, projected onto a wall, some bidders, representing in person, hold phones to their ears.
Sold -- to the gentlemen on the left... LINUS (Matt Damon) leans against the wall in the back of room, remaining inconspicuous.
Basher emerges. He puts on his sunglasses.  123. SFX: The gavel slams. INT. SOTHEBY’S - MOSCOW - EVENING Another gavel. Saul Bloom pets a cat seated on his lap. Smiles...
Debbie stands at the entrance to the subway talking to Ta Tammy has that slightly spent quality of someone who has recently “been emotional.”
I’m in for the next one. You know that.
Of course.
And if you get back to New York Maybe we could...
This is better. We talked about it. “Little League.”

(nods) Yeah... I wrote you a letter, but every time I read it just sounded so lame so... (pulls something from her bag) Here. Tammy hands her a lucite replica of the Statue of Liberty from the 3D printer.
Thanks.
Thanks for this. She pats the black messenger back hanging from her should It obviously contains her cut.
Well. She goes to hug Tammy who tries to lean-in but Deb gives the cheek.  124.
Right.
Deb pushes through the turnstile and moved up to the trac waiting for the 1. She heads all the way down the platfor toward the far end waiting for the last car.
Whizzing into the station with a blur. The train comes to rest and Deb moves through the last set of doors into the subway car.

Seated in various positions around the car are the rest o her crew. Cate, Rose, Nine Ball, Constance, Amita. Each o them has a black canvas messenger bag. Deb sits near Cate None of them make eye contact. The train moves. A panhandler sings “Lucy in the Sky with Diamonds.” Everyone stares straight ahead.
Coming to a stop. Amita gets up to leave. Gives Deb a win

head_text.subj: DOORS SHUT. SUBWAY STARTS AGAIN., (TIME LAPSE)

text: With each locked-off dissolve, another member of the team disappears -- There are now six, then five, then four, then finally...
(Gushy/tears) I’m really going to miss you.
Shh. Rose nods quickly. Remembers her cover. Exits the subway. They smile and...

head_text.subj: FINALLY ONLY DEBBIE AND CATE REMAIN

text: Alone in the subway. They ride for a while in silence...
14th St. Transfer to the N, Q, R, 7 and § trains.
Okay then....  125.
Ok. Cate rises. Starts to cross past her.
Hang on. Cate turns.
In all its surrealistic glory. CAESAR’S PALACE POOL Cate and Debbie lie side by side on chaise lounges in a cabana.
That's incredibly stupid.
Yeah?
Yeah. Deb smiles. Closes her eyes.
But good, right? Cate closes her eyes as well.
